00095 /** If a conversion from 'fromAtomicType' to 'toAtomicType' may cause lost
00096     precision, issue a warning.  Don't warn for conversions to bool and
00097     conversions between signed and unsigned integers of the same size.
00098  */
00099 static void
00100 lMaybeIssuePrecisionWarning(const AtomicType *toAtomicType, 
00101                             const AtomicType *fromAtomicType, 
00102                             SourcePos pos, const char *errorMsgBase) {
00103     switch (toAtomicType->basicType) {
00104     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
00105     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
00106     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
00107     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
00108     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
00109     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
00110     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
00111     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
00112     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
00113     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
00114     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
00115         if ((int)toAtomicType->basicType < (int)fromAtomicType->basicType &&
00116             toAtomicType->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL &&
00117             !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 && 
00118               fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8) &&
00119             !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT16 && 
00120               fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16) &&
00121             !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 && 
00122               fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32) &&
00123             !(toAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 && 
00124               fromAtomicType->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64))
00125             Warning(pos, "Conversion from type \"%s\" to type \"%s\" for %s"
00126                     " may lose information.",
00127                     fromAtomicType->GetString().c_str(), toAtomicType->GetString().c_str(),
00128                     errorMsgBase);
00129         break;
00130     default:
00131         FATAL("logic error in lMaybeIssuePrecisionWarning()");
00132     }
00133 }
00134 #endif

00138 static Expr *
00139 lArrayToPointer(Expr *expr) {
00140     Assert(expr && dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(expr->GetType()));
00141 
00142     Expr *zero = new ConstExpr(AtomicType::UniformInt32, 0, expr->pos);
00143     Expr *index = new IndexExpr(expr, zero, expr->pos);
00144     Expr *addr = new AddressOfExpr(index, expr->pos);
00145     addr = addr->TypeCheck();
00146     Assert(addr != NULL);
00147     addr = addr->Optimize();
00148     Assert(addr != NULL);
00149     return addr;
00150 }

00153 static bool
00154 lIsAllIntZeros(Expr *expr) {
00155     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
00156     if (type == NULL || type->IsIntType() == false)
00157         return false;
00158 
00159     ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
00160     if (ce == NULL)
00161         return false;
00162 
00163     uint64_t vals[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00164     int count = ce->AsUInt64(vals);
00165     if (count == 1) 
00166         return (vals[0] == 0);
00167     else {
00168         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00169             if (vals[i] != 0)
00170                 return false;
00171     }
00172     return true;
00173 }

00175 
00176 static bool
00177 lDoTypeConv(const Type *fromType, const Type *toType, Expr **expr,
00178             bool failureOk, const char *errorMsgBase, SourcePos pos) {
00179     /* This function is way too long and complex.  Is type conversion stuff
00180        always this messy, or can this be cleaned up somehow? */
00181     Assert(failureOk || errorMsgBase != NULL);
00182 
00183     if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
00184         return false;
00185 
00186     // The types are equal; there's nothing to do
00187     if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType))
00188         return true;
00189 
00190     if (fromType == AtomicType::Void) {
00191         if (!failureOk)
00192             Error(pos, "Can't convert from \"void\" to \"%s\" for %s.",
00193                   toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00194         return false;
00195     }
00196 
00197     if (toType == AtomicType::Void) {
00198         if (!failureOk)
00199             Error(pos, "Can't convert type \"%s\" to \"void\" for %s.",
00200                   fromType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00201         return false;
00202     }
00203 
00204     const ArrayType *toArrayType = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(toType);
00205     const ArrayType *fromArrayType = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(fromType);
00206     const VectorType *toVectorType = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(toType);
00207     const VectorType *fromVectorType = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(fromType);
00208     const StructType *toStructType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(toType);
00209     const StructType *fromStructType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(fromType);
00210     const EnumType *toEnumType = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(toType);
00211     const EnumType *fromEnumType = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(fromType);
00212     const AtomicType *toAtomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType);
00213     const AtomicType *fromAtomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(fromType);
00214     const PointerType *fromPointerType = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(fromType);
00215     const PointerType *toPointerType = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(toType);
00216 
00217     // Do this early, since for the case of a conversion like
00218     // "float foo[10]" -> "float * uniform foo", we have what's seemingly
00219     // a varying to uniform conversion (but not really)
00220     if (fromArrayType != NULL && toPointerType != NULL) {
00221         // array to pointer to array element type
00222         const Type *eltType = fromArrayType->GetElementType();
00223         if (toPointerType->GetBaseType()->IsConstType())
00224             eltType = eltType->GetAsConstType();
00225         if (Type::Equal(toPointerType, 
00226                         new PointerType(eltType,
00227                                         toPointerType->IsUniformType(),
00228                                         toPointerType->IsConstType())))
00229             goto typecast_ok;
00230         else {
00231             if (!failureOk)
00232                 Error(pos, "Can't convert from incompatible array type \"%s\" "
00233                       "to pointer type \"%s\" for %s.", 
00234                       fromType->GetString().c_str(),
00235                       toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00236             return false;
00237         }
00238     }
00239 
00240     if (toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()) {
00241         if (!failureOk)
00242             Error(pos, "Can't convert from varying type \"%s\" to uniform "
00243                   "type \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(), 
00244                   toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00245         return false;
00246     }
00247 
00248     if (fromPointerType != NULL) {
00249         if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType) != NULL &&
00250             toType->IsBoolType())
00251             // Allow implicit conversion of pointers to bools
00252             goto typecast_ok;
00253 
00254         if (toArrayType != NULL &&
00255             Type::Equal(fromType->GetBaseType(), toArrayType->GetElementType())) {
00256             // Can convert pointers to arrays of the same type
00257             goto typecast_ok;
00258         }
00259         if (toPointerType == NULL) {
00260             if (!failureOk)
00261                 Error(pos, "Can't convert between from pointer type "
00262                       "\"%s\" to non-pointer type \"%s\" for %s.", 
00263                       fromType->GetString().c_str(),
00264                       toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00265             return false;
00266         }
00267         else if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(toPointerType)) {
00268             // any pointer type can be converted to a void *
00269             goto typecast_ok;
00270         }
00271         else if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(fromPointerType) &&
00272                  expr != NULL &&
00273                  dynamic_cast<NullPointerExpr *>(*expr) != NULL) {
00274             // and a NULL convert to any other pointer type
00275             goto typecast_ok;
00276         }
00277         else if (!Type::Equal(fromPointerType->GetBaseType(), 
00278                               toPointerType->GetBaseType()) &&
00279                  !Type::Equal(fromPointerType->GetBaseType()->GetAsConstType(), 
00280                               toPointerType->GetBaseType())) {
00281             if (!failureOk)
00282                 Error(pos, "Can't convert between incompatible pointer types "
00283                       "\"%s\" and \"%s\" for %s.",
00284                       fromPointerType->GetString().c_str(),
00285                       toPointerType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00286             return false;
00287         }
00288 
00289         if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
00290             goto typecast_ok;
00291 
00292         // Otherwise there's nothing to do
00293         return true;
00294     }
00295 
00296     if (toPointerType != NULL && fromAtomicType != NULL && 
00297         fromAtomicType->IsIntType() && expr != NULL &&
00298         lIsAllIntZeros(*expr)) {
00299         // We have a zero-valued integer expression, which can also be
00300         // treated as a NULL pointer that can be converted to any other
00301         // pointer type.
00302         Expr *npe = new NullPointerExpr(pos);
00303         if (lDoTypeConv(PointerType::Void, toType, &npe,
00304                         failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos)) {
00305             *expr = npe;
00306             return true;
00307         }
00308         return false;
00309     }
00310         
00311     // Convert from type T -> const T; just return a TypeCast expr, which
00312     // can handle this
00313     if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType->GetAsConstType()))
00314         goto typecast_ok;
00315     
00316     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(fromType)) {
00317         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(toType)) {
00318             // Convert from a reference to a type to a const reference to a type;
00319             // this is handled by TypeCastExpr
00320             if (Type::Equal(toType->GetReferenceTarget(),
00321                             fromType->GetReferenceTarget()->GetAsConstType()))
00322                 goto typecast_ok;
00323 
00324             const ArrayType *atFrom = 
00325                 dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(fromType->GetReferenceTarget());
00326             const ArrayType *atTo = 
00327                 dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(toType->GetReferenceTarget());
00328 
00329             if (atFrom != NULL && atTo != NULL && 
00330                 Type::Equal(atFrom->GetElementType(), atTo->GetElementType())) {
00331                 goto typecast_ok;
00332             }
00333             else {
00334                 if (!failureOk)
00335                     Error(pos, "Can't convert between incompatible reference types \"%s\" "
00336                           "and \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
00337                           toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00338                 return false;
00339             }
00340         }
00341         else {
00342             // convert from a reference T -> T
00343             if (expr != NULL) {
00344                 Expr *drExpr = new DereferenceExpr(*expr, pos);
00345                 if (lDoTypeConv(drExpr->GetType(), toType, &drExpr, failureOk, 
00346                                 errorMsgBase, pos) == true) {
00347                     *expr = drExpr;
00348                     return true;
00349                 }
00350                 return false;
00351             }
00352             else
00353                 return lDoTypeConv(fromType->GetReferenceTarget(), toType, NULL,
00354                                    failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos);
00355         }
00356     }
00357     else if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(toType)) {
00358         // T -> reference T
00359         if (expr != NULL) {
00360             Expr *rExpr = new ReferenceExpr(*expr, pos);
00361             if (lDoTypeConv(rExpr->GetType(), toType, &rExpr, failureOk,
00362                             errorMsgBase, pos) == true) {
00363                 *expr = rExpr;
00364                 return true;
00365             }
00366             return false;
00367         }
00368         else
00369             return lDoTypeConv(new ReferenceType(fromType), toType, NULL, 
00370                                failureOk, errorMsgBase, pos);
00371     }
00372     else if (Type::Equal(toType, fromType->GetAsNonConstType()))
00373         // convert: const T -> T (as long as T isn't a reference)
00374         goto typecast_ok;
00375 
00376     fromType = fromType->GetReferenceTarget();
00377     toType = toType->GetReferenceTarget();
00378     if (toArrayType && fromArrayType) {
00379         if (Type::Equal(toArrayType->GetElementType(), 
00380                         fromArrayType->GetElementType())) {
00381             // the case of different element counts should have returned
00382             // successfully earlier, yes??
00383             Assert(toArrayType->GetElementCount() != fromArrayType->GetElementCount());
00384             goto typecast_ok;
00385         }
00386         else if (Type::Equal(toArrayType->GetElementType(), 
00387                              fromArrayType->GetElementType()->GetAsConstType())) {
00388             // T[x] -> const T[x]
00389             goto typecast_ok;
00390         }
00391         else {
00392             if (!failureOk)
00393                 Error(pos, "Array type \"%s\" can't be converted to type \"%s\" for %s.",
00394                       fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str(),
00395                       errorMsgBase);
00396             return false;
00397         }
00398     }
00399 
00400     if (toVectorType && fromVectorType) {
00401         // converting e.g. int<n> -> float<n>
00402         if (fromVectorType->GetElementCount() != toVectorType->GetElementCount()) {
00403             if (!failureOk)
00404                 Error(pos, "Can't convert between differently sized vector types "
00405                       "\"%s\" -> \"%s\" for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
00406                       toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00407             return false;
00408         }
00409         goto typecast_ok;
00410     }
00411 
00412     if (toStructType && fromStructType) {
00413         if (!Type::Equal(toStructType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType(),
00414                          fromStructType->GetAsUniformType()->GetAsConstType())) {
00415             if (!failureOk)
00416                 Error(pos, "Can't convert between different struct types "
00417                       "\"%s\" and \"%s\" for %s.", fromStructType->GetString().c_str(),
00418                       toStructType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00419             return false;
00420         }
00421         goto typecast_ok;
00422     }
00423 
00424     if (toEnumType != NULL && fromEnumType != NULL) {
00425         // No implicit conversions between different enum types
00426         if (!Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toEnumType->GetAsUniformType(),
00427                                      fromEnumType->GetAsUniformType())) {
00428             if (!failureOk)
00429                 Error(pos, "Can't convert between different enum types "
00430                       "\"%s\" and \"%s\" for %s", fromEnumType->GetString().c_str(),
00431                       toEnumType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00432             return false;
00433         }
00434         goto typecast_ok;
00435     }
00436 
00437     // enum -> atomic (integer, generally...) is always ok
00438     if (fromEnumType != NULL) {
00439         Assert(toAtomicType != NULL || toVectorType != NULL);
00440         goto typecast_ok;
00441     }
00442 
00443     // from here on out, the from type can only be atomic something or
00444     // other...
00445     if (fromAtomicType == NULL) {
00446         if (!failureOk)
00447             Error(pos, "Type conversion only possible from atomic types, not "
00448                   "from \"%s\" to \"%s\", for %s.", fromType->GetString().c_str(), 
00449                   toType->GetString().c_str(), errorMsgBase);
00450         return false;
00451     }
00452 
00453     // scalar -> short-vector conversions
00454     if (toVectorType != NULL)
00455         goto typecast_ok;
00456 
00457     // ok, it better be a scalar->scalar conversion of some sort by now
00458     if (toAtomicType == NULL) {
00459         if (!failureOk)
00460             Error(pos, "Type conversion only possible to atomic types, not "
00461                   "from \"%s\" to \"%s\", for %s.",
00462                   fromType->GetString().c_str(), toType->GetString().c_str(), 
00463                   errorMsgBase);
00464         return false;
00465     }
00466 
00467  typecast_ok:
00468     if (expr != NULL)
00469         *expr = new TypeCastExpr(toType, *expr, false, pos);
00470     return true;
00471 }

00474 bool
00475 CanConvertTypes(const Type *fromType, const Type *toType, 
00476                 const char *errorMsgBase, SourcePos pos) {
00477     return lDoTypeConv(fromType, toType, NULL, errorMsgBase == NULL,
00478                        errorMsgBase, pos);
00479 }

00481 
00482 Expr *
00483 TypeConvertExpr(Expr *expr, const Type *toType, const char *errorMsgBase) {
00484     if (expr == NULL)
00485         return NULL;
00486 
00487     const Type *fromType = expr->GetType();
00488     Expr *e = expr;
00489     if (lDoTypeConv(fromType, toType, &e, false, errorMsgBase, 
00490                     expr->pos))
00491         return e;
00492     else
00493         return NULL;
00494 }

00499 /** Given an atomic or vector type, this returns a boolean type with the
00500     same "shape".  In other words, if the given type is a vector type of
00501     three uniform ints, the returned type is a vector type of three uniform
00502     bools. */
00503 static const Type *
00504 lMatchingBoolType(const Type *type) {
00505     bool uniformTest = type->IsUniformType();
00506     const AtomicType *boolBase = uniformTest ? AtomicType::UniformBool : 
00507                                                AtomicType::VaryingBool;
00508     const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
00509     if (vt != NULL)
00510         return new VectorType(boolBase, vt->GetElementCount());
00511     else {
00512         Assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL ||
00513                dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type) != NULL);
00514         return boolBase;
00515     }
00516 }

00518 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00519 // UnaryExpr
00520 
00521 static llvm::Constant *
00522 lLLVMConstantValue(const Type *type, llvm::LLVMContext *ctx, double value) {
00523     const AtomicType *atomicType = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
00524     const EnumType *enumType = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type);
00525     const VectorType *vectorType = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
00526     const PointerType *pointerType = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type);
00527 
00528     // This function is only called with, and only works for atomic, enum,
00529     // and vector types.
00530     Assert(atomicType != NULL || enumType != NULL || vectorType != NULL ||
00531            pointerType != NULL);
00532 
00533     if (atomicType != NULL || enumType != NULL) {
00534         // If it's an atomic or enuemrator type, then figure out which of
00535         // the llvmutil.h functions to call to get the corresponding
00536         // constant and then call it...
00537         bool isUniform = type->IsUniformType();
00538         AtomicType::BasicType basicType = (enumType != NULL) ? 
00539             AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 : atomicType->basicType;
00540 
00541         switch (basicType) {
00542         case AtomicType::TYPE_VOID:
00543             FATAL("can't get constant value for void type");
00544             return NULL;
00545         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
00546             if (isUniform)
00547                 return (value != 0.) ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
00548             else
00549                 return LLVMBoolVector(value != 0.);
00550         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
00551             int i = (int)value;
00552             Assert((double)i == value);
00553             return isUniform ? LLVMInt8(i) : LLVMInt8Vector(i);
00554         }
00555         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
00556             unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
00557             return isUniform ? LLVMUInt8(i) : LLVMUInt8Vector(i);
00558         }
00559         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
00560             int i = (int)value;
00561             Assert((double)i == value);
00562             return isUniform ? LLVMInt16(i) : LLVMInt16Vector(i);
00563         }
00564         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
00565             unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
00566             return isUniform ? LLVMUInt16(i) : LLVMUInt16Vector(i);
00567         }
00568         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
00569             int i = (int)value;
00570             Assert((double)i == value);
00571             return isUniform ? LLVMInt32(i) : LLVMInt32Vector(i);
00572         }
00573         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
00574             unsigned int i = (unsigned int)value;
00575             return isUniform ? LLVMUInt32(i) : LLVMUInt32Vector(i);
00576         }
00577         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
00578             return isUniform ? LLVMFloat((float)value) : 
00579                                LLVMFloatVector((float)value);
00580         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
00581             uint64_t i = (uint64_t)value;
00582             Assert(value == (int64_t)i);
00583             return isUniform ? LLVMUInt64(i) : LLVMUInt64Vector(i);
00584         }
00585         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
00586             int64_t i = (int64_t)value;
00587             Assert((double)i == value);
00588             return isUniform ? LLVMInt64(i) : LLVMInt64Vector(i);
00589         }
00590         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
00591             return isUniform ? LLVMDouble(value) : LLVMDoubleVector(value);
00592         default:
00593             FATAL("logic error in lLLVMConstantValue");
00594             return NULL;
00595         }
00596     }
00597     else if (pointerType != NULL) {
00598         Assert(value == 0);
00599         if (pointerType->IsUniformType())
00600             return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerType);
00601         else
00602             return llvm::Constant::getNullValue(LLVMTypes::VoidPointerVectorType);
00603     }
00604     else {
00605         // For vector types, first get the LLVM constant for the basetype with
00606         // a recursive call to lLLVMConstantValue().
00607         const Type *baseType = vectorType->GetBaseType();
00608         llvm::Constant *constElement = lLLVMConstantValue(baseType, ctx, value);
00609         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmVectorType = vectorType->LLVMType(ctx);
00610 
00611         // Now create a constant version of the corresponding LLVM type that we
00612         // use to represent the VectorType.
00613         // FIXME: this is a little ugly in that the fact that ispc represents
00614         // uniform VectorTypes as LLVM VectorTypes and varying VectorTypes as
00615         // LLVM ArrayTypes leaks into the code here; it feels like this detail
00616         // should be better encapsulated?
00617         if (baseType->IsUniformType()) {
00618             LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType *lvt = 
00619                 llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::VectorType>(llvmVectorType);
00620             Assert(lvt != NULL);
00621             std::vector<llvm::Constant *> vals;
00622             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < lvt->getNumElements(); ++i)
00623                 vals.push_back(constElement);
00624             return llvm::ConstantVector::get(vals);
00625         }
00626         else {
00627             LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *lat = 
00628                 llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(llvmVectorType);
00629             Assert(lat != NULL);
00630             std::vector<llvm::Constant *> vals;
00631             for (unsigned int i = 0; i < lat->getNumElements(); ++i)
00632                 vals.push_back(constElement);
00633             return llvm::ConstantArray::get(lat, vals);
00634         }
00635     }
00636 }
00637 
00638 
00639 static llvm::Value *
00640 lMaskForSymbol(Symbol *baseSym, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
00641     if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(baseSym->type) != NULL ||
00642         dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(baseSym->type) != NULL)
00643         // FIXME: for pointers, we really only want to do this for
00644         // dereferencing the pointer, not for things like pointer
00645         // arithmetic, when we may be able to use the internal mask,
00646         // depending on context...
00647         return ctx->GetFullMask();
00648 
00649     llvm::Value *mask = (baseSym->parentFunction == ctx->GetFunction() && 
00650                          baseSym->storageClass != SC_STATIC) ? 
00651         ctx->GetInternalMask() : ctx->GetFullMask();
00652     return mask;
00653 }
00654 
00655 
00656 /** Store the result of an assignment to the given location. 
00657  */
00658 static void
00659 lStoreAssignResult(llvm::Value *value, llvm::Value *ptr, const Type *ptrType,
00660                    FunctionEmitContext *ctx, Symbol *baseSym) {
00661     Assert(baseSym != NULL &&
00662            baseSym->varyingCFDepth <= ctx->VaryingCFDepth());
00663     if (!g->opt.disableMaskedStoreToStore &&
00664         !g->opt.disableMaskAllOnOptimizations &&
00665         baseSym->varyingCFDepth == ctx->VaryingCFDepth() &&
00666         baseSym->storageClass != SC_STATIC &&
00667         dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(baseSym->type) == NULL &&
00668         dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(baseSym->type) == NULL) {
00669         // If the variable is declared at the same varying control flow
00670         // depth as where it's being assigned, then we don't need to do any
00671         // masking but can just do the assignment as if all the lanes were
00672         // known to be on.  While this may lead to random/garbage values
00673         // written into the lanes that are off, by definition they will
00674         // never be accessed, since those lanes aren't executing, and won't
00675         // be executing at this scope or any other one before the variable
00676         // goes out of scope.
00677         ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr, LLVMMaskAllOn, ptrType);
00678     }
00679     else {
00680         ctx->StoreInst(value, ptr, lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx), ptrType);
00681     }
00682 }
00683 
00684 
00685 /** Utility routine to emit code to do a {pre,post}-{inc,dec}rement of the
00686     given expresion.
00687  */
00688 static llvm::Value *
00689 lEmitPrePostIncDec(UnaryExpr::Op op, Expr *expr, SourcePos pos,
00690                    FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
00691     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
00692     if (type == NULL)
00693         return NULL;
00694 
00695     // Get both the lvalue and the rvalue of the given expression
00696     llvm::Value *lvalue = NULL, *rvalue = NULL;
00697     const Type *lvalueType = NULL;
00698     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type) != NULL) {
00699         lvalueType = type;
00700         type = type->GetReferenceTarget();
00701         lvalue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
00702 
00703         Expr *deref = new DereferenceExpr(expr, expr->pos);
00704         rvalue = deref->GetValue(ctx);
00705     }
00706     else {
00707         lvalue = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
00708         lvalueType = expr->GetLValueType();
00709         rvalue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
00710     }
00711 
00712     if (lvalue == NULL) {
00713         // If we can't get a lvalue, then we have an error here 
00714         const char *prepost = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || 
00715                                op == UnaryExpr::PreDec) ? "pre" : "post";
00716         const char *incdec = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || 
00717                               op == UnaryExpr::PostInc) ? "increment" : "decrement";
00718         Error(pos, "Can't %s-%s non-lvalues.", prepost, incdec);
00719         return NULL;
00720     }
00721 
00722     // Emit code to do the appropriate addition/subtraction to the
00723     // expression's old value
00724     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00725     llvm::Value *binop = NULL;
00726     int delta = (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PostInc) ? 1 : -1;
00727 
00728     if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type) != NULL) {
00729         const Type *incType = type->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 :
00730             AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
00731         llvm::Constant *dval = lLLVMConstantValue(incType, g->ctx, delta);
00732         binop = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(rvalue, dval, type, "ptr_inc_or_dec");
00733     }
00734     else {
00735         llvm::Constant *dval = lLLVMConstantValue(type, g->ctx, delta);
00736         if (type->IsFloatType())
00737             binop = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::FAdd, rvalue, 
00738                                         dval, "val_inc_or_dec");
00739         else
00740             binop = ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Add, rvalue, 
00741                                         dval, "val_inc_or_dec");
00742     }
00743 
00744     // And store the result out to the lvalue
00745     Symbol *baseSym = expr->GetBaseSymbol();
00746     lStoreAssignResult(binop, lvalue, lvalueType, ctx, baseSym);
00747 
00748     // And then if it's a pre increment/decrement, return the final
00749     // computed result; otherwise return the previously-grabbed expression
00750     // value.
00751     return (op == UnaryExpr::PreInc || op == UnaryExpr::PreDec) ? binop : rvalue;
00752 }
00753 
00754 
00755 
00756 /** Utility routine to emit code to negate the given expression.
00757  */
00758 static llvm::Value *
00759 lEmitNegate(Expr *arg, SourcePos pos, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
00760     const Type *type = arg->GetType();
00761     llvm::Value *argVal = arg->GetValue(ctx);
00762     if (type == NULL || argVal == NULL)
00763         return NULL;
00764 
00765     // Negate by subtracting from zero...
00766     llvm::Value *zero = lLLVMConstantValue(type, g->ctx, 0.);
00767     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00768     if (type->IsFloatType())
00769         return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::FSub, zero, argVal,
00770                                    "fnegate");
00771     else {
00772         Assert(type->IsIntType());
00773         return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, zero, argVal,
00774                                    "inegate");
00775     }
00776 }
00777 
00778 
00779 UnaryExpr::UnaryExpr(Op o, Expr *e, SourcePos p) 
00780   : Expr(p), op(o) { 
00781     expr = e;
00782 }
00783 
00784 
00785 llvm::Value *
00786 UnaryExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
00787     if (expr == NULL)
00788         return NULL;
00789 
00790     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
00791 
00792     switch (op) {
00793     case PreInc:
00794     case PreDec:
00795     case PostInc:
00796     case PostDec:
00797         return lEmitPrePostIncDec(op, expr, pos, ctx);
00798     case Negate:
00799         return lEmitNegate(expr, pos, ctx);
00800     case LogicalNot: {
00801         llvm::Value *argVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
00802         return ctx->NotOperator(argVal, "logicalnot");
00803     }
00804     case BitNot: {
00805         llvm::Value *argVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
00806         return ctx->NotOperator(argVal, "bitnot");
00807     }
00808     default:
00809         FATAL("logic error");
00810         return NULL;
00811     }
00812 }
00813 
00814 
00815 const Type *
00816 UnaryExpr::GetType() const {
00817     if (expr == NULL)
00818         return NULL;
00819 
00820     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
00821     if (type == NULL)
00822         return NULL;
00823 
00824     // For all unary expressions besides logical not, the returned type is
00825     // the same as the source type.  Logical not always returns a bool
00826     // type, with the same shape as the input type.
00827     switch (op) {
00828     case PreInc:
00829     case PreDec:
00830     case PostInc:
00831     case PostDec:
00832     case Negate:
00833     case BitNot: 
00834         return type;
00835     case LogicalNot:
00836         return lMatchingBoolType(type);
00837     default:
00838         FATAL("error");
00839         return NULL;
00840     }
00841 }
00842 
00843 
00844 Expr *
00845 UnaryExpr::Optimize() {
00846     if (!expr)
00847         return NULL;
00848 
00849     expr = expr->Optimize();
00850 
00851     ConstExpr *constExpr = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
00852     // If the operand isn't a constant, then we can't do any optimization
00853     // here...
00854     if (constExpr == NULL)
00855         return this;
00856 
00857     const Type *type = constExpr->GetType();
00858     bool isEnumType = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL;
00859 
00860     const Type *baseType = type->GetAsNonConstType()->GetAsUniformType();
00861     if (baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt8 ||
00862         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt8 ||
00863         baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt16 ||
00864         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt16 ||
00865         baseType == AtomicType::UniformInt64 ||
00866         baseType == AtomicType::UniformUInt64)
00867         // FIXME: should handle these at some point; for now we only do
00868         // constant folding for bool, int32 and float types...
00869         return this;
00870 
00871     switch (op) {
00872     case PreInc:
00873     case PreDec:
00874     case PostInc:
00875     case PostDec:
00876         // this shouldn't happen--it's illegal to modify a contant value..
00877         // An error will be issued elsewhere...
00878         return this;
00879     case Negate: {
00880         // Since we currently only handle int32, floats, and doubles here,
00881         // it's safe to stuff whatever we have into a double, do the negate
00882         // as a double, and then return a ConstExpr with the same type as
00883         // the original...
00884         double v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00885         int count = constExpr->AsDouble(v);
00886         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00887             v[i] = -v[i];
00888         return new ConstExpr(constExpr, v);
00889     }
00890     case BitNot: {
00891         if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt32 || 
00892             type == AtomicType::VaryingInt32 ||
00893             type == AtomicType::UniformConstInt32 || 
00894             type == AtomicType::VaryingConstInt32) {
00895             int32_t v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00896             int count = constExpr->AsInt32(v);
00897             for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00898                 v[i] = ~v[i];
00899             return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
00900         }
00901         else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt32 || 
00902                  type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 ||
00903                  type == AtomicType::UniformConstUInt32 || 
00904                  type == AtomicType::VaryingConstUInt32 ||
00905                  isEnumType == true) {
00906             uint32_t v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00907             int count = constExpr->AsUInt32(v);
00908             for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00909                 v[i] = ~v[i];
00910             return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
00911         }
00912         else
00913             FATAL("unexpected type in UnaryExpr::Optimize() / BitNot case");
00914     }
00915     case LogicalNot: {
00916         Assert(type == AtomicType::UniformBool || 
00917                type == AtomicType::VaryingBool ||
00918                type == AtomicType::UniformConstBool || 
00919                type == AtomicType::VaryingConstBool);
00920         bool v[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
00921         int count = constExpr->AsBool(v);
00922         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
00923             v[i] = !v[i];
00924         return new ConstExpr(type, v, pos);
00925     }
00926     default:
00927         FATAL("unexpected op in UnaryExpr::Optimize()");
00928         return NULL;
00929     }
00930 }
00931 
00932 
00933 Expr *
00934 UnaryExpr::TypeCheck() {
00935     if (expr != NULL) 
00936         expr = expr->TypeCheck();
00937     if (expr == NULL)
00938         // something went wrong in type checking...
00939         return NULL;
00940 
00941     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
00942     if (type == NULL)
00943         return NULL;
00944 
00945     if (op == PreInc || op == PreDec || op == PostInc || op == PostDec) {
00946         if (type->IsConstType()) {
00947             Error(pos, "Can't assign to type \"%s\" on left-hand side of "
00948                   "expression.", type->GetString().c_str());
00949             return NULL;
00950         }
00951 
00952         if (type->IsNumericType())
00953             return this;
00954 
00955         if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type) == NULL) {
00956             Error(expr->pos, "Can only pre/post increment numeric and "
00957                   "pointer types, not \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
00958             return NULL;
00959         }
00960 
00961         if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(type)) {
00962             Error(expr->pos, "Illegal to pre/post increment \"%s\" type.",
00963                   type->GetString().c_str());
00964             return NULL;
00965         }
00966 
00967         return this;
00968     }
00969 
00970     // don't do this for pre/post increment/decrement
00971     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type)) {
00972         expr = new DereferenceExpr(expr, pos);
00973         type = expr->GetType();
00974     }
00975 
00976     if (op == Negate) {
00977         if (!type->IsNumericType()) {
00978             Error(expr->pos, "Negate not allowed for non-numeric type \"%s\".", 
00979                   type->GetString().c_str());
00980             return NULL;
00981         }
00982     }
00983     else if (op == LogicalNot) {
00984         const Type *boolType = lMatchingBoolType(type);
00985         expr = TypeConvertExpr(expr, boolType, "logical not");
00986         if (expr == NULL)
00987             return NULL;
00988     }
00989     else if (op == BitNot) {
00990         if (!type->IsIntType()) {
00991             Error(expr->pos, "~ operator can only be used with integer types, "
00992                   "not \"%s\".", type->GetString().c_str());
00993             return NULL;
00994         }
00995     }
00996     return this;
00997 }
00998 
00999 
01000 int
01001 UnaryExpr::EstimateCost() const {
01002     return (expr ? expr->EstimateCost() : 0) + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
01003 }
01004 
01005 
01006 void
01007 UnaryExpr::Print() const {
01008     if (!expr || !GetType())
01009         return;
01010 
01011     printf("[ %s ] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
01012     if (op == PreInc) printf("++");
01013     if (op == PreDec) printf("--");
01014     if (op == Negate) printf("-");
01015     if (op == LogicalNot) printf("!");
01016     if (op == BitNot) printf("~");
01017     printf("(");
01018     expr->Print();
01019     printf(")");
01020     if (op == PostInc) printf("++");
01021     if (op == PostDec) printf("--");
01022     printf(")");
01023     pos.Print();
01024 }

01027 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01028 // BinaryExpr
01029 
01030 static const char *
01031 lOpString(BinaryExpr::Op op) {
01032     switch (op) {
01033     case BinaryExpr::Add:        return "+";
01034     case BinaryExpr::Sub:        return "-";
01035     case BinaryExpr::Mul:        return "*";
01036     case BinaryExpr::Div:        return "/";
01037     case BinaryExpr::Mod:        return "%";
01038     case BinaryExpr::Shl:        return "<<";
01039     case BinaryExpr::Shr:        return ">>";
01040     case BinaryExpr::Lt:         return "<";
01041     case BinaryExpr::Gt:         return ">";
01042     case BinaryExpr::Le:         return "<=";
01043     case BinaryExpr::Ge:         return ">=";
01044     case BinaryExpr::Equal:      return "==";
01045     case BinaryExpr::NotEqual:   return "!=";
01046     case BinaryExpr::BitAnd:     return "&";
01047     case BinaryExpr::BitXor:     return "^";
01048     case BinaryExpr::BitOr:      return "|";
01049     case BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd: return "&&";
01050     case BinaryExpr::LogicalOr:  return "||";
01051     case BinaryExpr::Comma:      return ",";
01052     default:
01053         FATAL("unimplemented case in lOpString()");
01054         return "";
01055     }
01056 }
01057 
01058 
01059 /** Utility routine to emit the binary bitwise operator corresponding to
01060     the given BinaryExpr::Op. 
01061 */
01062 static llvm::Value *
01063 lEmitBinaryBitOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *arg0Val,
01064                  llvm::Value *arg1Val, bool isUnsigned,
01065                  FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
01066     llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst;
01067     switch (op) {
01068     case BinaryExpr::Shl:    inst = llvm::Instruction::Shl;  break;
01069     case BinaryExpr::Shr:
01070         if (isUnsigned)
01071             inst = llvm::Instruction::LShr; 
01072         else
01073             inst = llvm::Instruction::AShr; 
01074         break; 
01075     case BinaryExpr::BitAnd: inst = llvm::Instruction::And;  break;
01076     case BinaryExpr::BitXor: inst = llvm::Instruction::Xor;  break;
01077     case BinaryExpr::BitOr:  inst = llvm::Instruction::Or;   break;
01078     default:
01079         FATAL("logic error in lEmitBinaryBitOp()");
01080         return NULL;
01081     }
01082 
01083     return ctx->BinaryOperator(inst, arg0Val, arg1Val, "bitop");
01084 }
01085 
01086 
01087 /** Utility routine to emit binary arithmetic operator based on the given
01088     BinaryExpr::Op.
01089 */
01090 static llvm::Value *
01091 lEmitBinaryArith(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *value0, llvm::Value *value1,
01092                  const Type *type0, const Type *type1,
01093                  FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
01094     const PointerType *ptrType = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type0);
01095 
01096     if (ptrType != NULL) {
01097         switch (op) {
01098         case BinaryExpr::Add:
01099             // ptr + integer
01100             return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(value0, value1, ptrType, "ptrmath");
01101             break;
01102         case BinaryExpr::Sub: {
01103             if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type1) != NULL) {
01104                 // ptr - ptr
01105                 if (ptrType->IsUniformType()) {
01106                     value0 = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value0);
01107                     value1 = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value1);
01108                 }
01109 
01110                 // Compute the difference in bytes
01111                 llvm::Value *delta = 
01112                     ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, value0, value1,
01113                                         "ptr_diff");
01114 
01115                 // Now divide by the size of the type that the pointer
01116                 // points to in order to return the difference in elements.
01117                 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmElementType = 
01118                     ptrType->GetBaseType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
01119                 llvm::Value *size = g->target.SizeOf(llvmElementType);
01120                 if (ptrType->IsVaryingType())
01121                     size = ctx->SmearUniform(size);
01122 
01123                 if (g->target.is32Bit == false && 
01124                     g->opt.force32BitAddressing == true) {
01125                     // If we're doing 32-bit addressing math on a 64-bit
01126                     // target, then trunc the delta down to a 32-bit value.
01127                     // (Thus also matching what will be a 32-bit value
01128                     // returned from SizeOf above.)
01129                     if (ptrType->IsUniformType())
01130                         delta = ctx->TruncInst(delta, LLVMTypes::Int32Type,
01131                                                "trunc_ptr_delta");
01132                     else
01133                         delta = ctx->TruncInst(delta, LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType,
01134                                                "trunc_ptr_delta");
01135                 }
01136 
01137                 // And now do the actual division
01138                 return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::SDiv, delta, size,
01139                                            "element_diff");
01140             }
01141             else {
01142                 // ptr - integer
01143                 llvm::Value *zero = lLLVMConstantValue(type1, g->ctx, 0.);
01144                 llvm::Value *negOffset = 
01145                     ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Sub, zero, value1, 
01146                                         "negate");
01147                 // Do a GEP as ptr + -integer
01148                 return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(value0, negOffset, ptrType, 
01149                                               "ptrmath");
01150             }
01151         }
01152         default:
01153             FATAL("Logic error in lEmitBinaryArith() for pointer type case");
01154             return NULL;
01155         }
01156     }
01157     else {
01158         Assert(Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type0, type1));
01159 
01160         llvm::Instruction::BinaryOps inst;
01161         bool isFloatOp = type0->IsFloatType();
01162         bool isUnsignedOp = type0->IsUnsignedType();
01163 
01164         switch (op) {
01165         case BinaryExpr::Add:
01166             inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FAdd : llvm::Instruction::Add;
01167             break;
01168         case BinaryExpr::Sub:
01169             inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FSub : llvm::Instruction::Sub;
01170             break;
01171         case BinaryExpr::Mul:
01172             inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FMul : llvm::Instruction::Mul;
01173             break;
01174         case BinaryExpr::Div:
01175             if (type0->IsVaryingType() && !isFloatOp)
01176                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Division with varying integer types is "
01177                                    "very inefficient."); 
01178             inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FDiv : 
01179                 (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::Instruction::UDiv : llvm::Instruction::SDiv);
01180             break;
01181         case BinaryExpr::Mod:
01182             if (type0->IsVaryingType() && !isFloatOp)
01183                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Modulus operator with varying types is "
01184                                    "very inefficient."); 
01185             inst = isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FRem : 
01186                 (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::Instruction::URem : llvm::Instruction::SRem);
01187             break;
01188         default:
01189             FATAL("Invalid op type passed to lEmitBinaryArith()");
01190             return NULL;
01191         }
01192 
01193         return ctx->BinaryOperator(inst, value0, value1, "binop");
01194     }
01195 }
01196 
01197 
01198 /** Utility routine to emit a binary comparison operator based on the given
01199     BinaryExpr::Op.
01200  */
01201 static llvm::Value *
01202 lEmitBinaryCmp(BinaryExpr::Op op, llvm::Value *e0Val, llvm::Value *e1Val,
01203                const Type *type, FunctionEmitContext *ctx, SourcePos pos) {
01204     bool isFloatOp = type->IsFloatType();
01205     bool isUnsignedOp = type->IsUnsignedType();
01206 
01207     llvm::CmpInst::Predicate pred;
01208     switch (op) {
01209     case BinaryExpr::Lt:
01210         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OLT : 
01211             (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_ULT : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SLT);
01212         break;
01213     case BinaryExpr::Gt:
01214         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OGT : 
01215             (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_UGT : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SGT);
01216         break;
01217     case BinaryExpr::Le:
01218         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OLE : 
01219             (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_ULE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SLE);
01220         break;
01221     case BinaryExpr::Ge:
01222         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OGE : 
01223             (isUnsignedOp ? llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_UGE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_SGE);
01224         break;
01225     case BinaryExpr::Equal:
01226         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_OEQ : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_EQ;
01227         break;
01228     case BinaryExpr::NotEqual:
01229         pred = isFloatOp ? llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE : llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE;
01230         break;
01231     default:
01232         FATAL("error in lEmitBinaryCmp()");
01233         return NULL;
01234     }
01235 
01236     llvm::Value *cmp = ctx->CmpInst(isFloatOp ? llvm::Instruction::FCmp : 
01237                                     llvm::Instruction::ICmp,
01238                                     pred, e0Val, e1Val, "bincmp");
01239     // This is a little ugly: CmpInst returns i1 values, but we use vectors
01240     // of i32s for varying bool values; type convert the result here if
01241     // needed.
01242     if (type->IsVaryingType())
01243         cmp = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
01244 
01245     return cmp;
01246 }
01247 
01248 
01249 BinaryExpr::BinaryExpr(Op o, Expr *a, Expr *b, SourcePos p) 
01250     : Expr(p), op(o) {
01251     arg0 = a;
01252     arg1 = b;
01253 }
01254 
01255 
01256 llvm::Value *
01257 BinaryExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
01258     if (!arg0 || !arg1)
01259         return NULL;
01260 
01261     llvm::Value *value0 = arg0->GetValue(ctx);
01262     llvm::Value *value1 = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
01263     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01264 
01265     switch (op) {
01266     case Add:
01267     case Sub:
01268     case Mul:
01269     case Div:
01270     case Mod:
01271         return lEmitBinaryArith(op, value0, value1, arg0->GetType(), arg1->GetType(),
01272                                 ctx, pos);
01273     case Lt:
01274     case Gt:
01275     case Le:
01276     case Ge:
01277     case Equal:
01278     case NotEqual:
01279         return lEmitBinaryCmp(op, value0, value1, arg0->GetType(), ctx, pos);
01280     case Shl:
01281     case Shr:
01282     case BitAnd:
01283     case BitXor:
01284     case BitOr: {
01285         if (op == Shr && arg1->GetType()->IsVaryingType() && 
01286             dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1) == NULL)
01287             PerformanceWarning(pos, "Shift right is extremely inefficient for "
01288                                "varying shift amounts.");
01289         return lEmitBinaryBitOp(op, value0, value1, 
01290                                 arg0->GetType()->IsUnsignedType(), ctx);
01291     }
01292     case LogicalAnd:
01293         return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::And, value0, value1,
01294                                    "logical_and");
01295     case LogicalOr:
01296         return ctx->BinaryOperator(llvm::Instruction::Or, value0, value1, 
01297                                    "logical_or");
01298     case Comma:
01299         return value1;
01300     default:
01301         FATAL("logic error");
01302         return NULL;
01303     }
01304 }
01305 
01306 
01307 const Type *
01308 BinaryExpr::GetType() const {
01309     if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01310         return NULL;
01311 
01312     const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
01313     if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL)
01314         return NULL;
01315 
01316     // If this hits, it means that our TypeCheck() method hasn't been
01317     // called before GetType() was called; adding two pointers is illegal
01318     // and will fail type checking and (int + ptr) should be canonicalized
01319     // into (ptr + int) by type checking.
01320     if (op == Add)
01321         Assert(dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type1) == NULL);
01322 
01323     if (op == Comma)
01324         return arg1->GetType();
01325 
01326     if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type0) != NULL) {
01327         if (op == Add)
01328             // ptr + int -> ptr
01329             return type0;
01330         else if (op == Sub) {
01331             if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type1) != NULL) {
01332                 // ptr - ptr -> ~ptrdiff_t
01333                 const Type *diffType = (g->target.is32Bit || 
01334                                         g->opt.force32BitAddressing) ? 
01335                     AtomicType::UniformInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
01336                 if (type0->IsVaryingType() || type1->IsVaryingType())
01337                     diffType = diffType->GetAsVaryingType();
01338                 return diffType;
01339             }
01340             else
01341                 // ptr - int -> ptr
01342                 return type0;
01343         }
01344 
01345         // otherwise fall through for these...
01346         Assert(op == Lt || op == Gt || op == Le || op == Ge ||
01347                op == Equal || op == NotEqual);
01348     }
01349 
01350     const Type *exprType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, pos, lOpString(op));
01351     // I don't think that MoreGeneralType should be able to fail after the
01352     // checks done in BinaryExpr::TypeCheck().
01353     Assert(exprType != NULL);
01354 
01355     switch (op) {
01356     case Add:
01357     case Sub:
01358     case Mul:
01359     case Div:
01360     case Mod:
01361         return exprType;
01362     case Lt:
01363     case Gt:
01364     case Le:
01365     case Ge:
01366     case Equal:
01367     case NotEqual:
01368     case LogicalAnd:
01369     case LogicalOr:
01370         return lMatchingBoolType(exprType);
01371     case Shl:
01372     case Shr:
01373         return type1->IsVaryingType() ? type0->GetAsVaryingType() : type0;
01374     case BitAnd:
01375     case BitXor:
01376     case BitOr:
01377         return exprType;
01378     case Comma:
01379         // handled above, so fall through here just in case
01380     default:
01381         FATAL("logic error in BinaryExpr::GetType()");
01382         return NULL;
01383     }
01384 }
01385 
01386 
01387 #define FOLD_OP(O, E)                           \
01388     case O:                                     \
01389         for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)         \
01390             result[i] = (v0[i] E v1[i]);        \
01391         break
01392 
01393 /** Constant fold the binary integer operations that aren't also applicable
01394     to floating-point types. 
01395 */
01396 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
01397 lConstFoldBinIntOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0) {
01398     T result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01399     int count = carg0->Count();
01400         
01401     switch (op) {
01402         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Mod, %);
01403         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Shl, <<);
01404         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Shr, >>);
01405         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, &);
01406         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitXor, ^);
01407         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitOr, |);
01408     default:
01409         return NULL;
01410     }
01411 
01412     return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
01413 }
01414 
01415 
01416 /** Constant fold the binary logical ops.
01417  */ 
01418 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
01419 lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0) {
01420     bool result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01421     int count = carg0->Count();
01422 
01423     switch (op) {
01424         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Lt, <);
01425         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Gt, >);
01426         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Le, <=);
01427         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Ge, >=);
01428         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Equal, ==);
01429         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, !=);
01430         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, &&);
01431         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, ||);
01432     default:
01433         return NULL;
01434     }
01435 
01436     const Type *rType = carg0->GetType()->IsUniformType() ? 
01437         AtomicType::UniformBool : AtomicType::VaryingBool;
01438     return new ConstExpr(rType, result, carg0->pos);
01439 }
01440 
01441 
01442 /** Constant fold binary arithmetic ops.
01443  */
01444 template <typename T> static ConstExpr *
01445 lConstFoldBinArithOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const T *v0, const T *v1, ConstExpr *carg0) {
01446     T result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01447     int count = carg0->Count();
01448 
01449     switch (op) {
01450         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Add, +);
01451         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Sub, -);
01452         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Mul, *);
01453         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Div, /);
01454     default:
01455         return NULL;
01456     }
01457     
01458     return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
01459 }
01460 
01461 
01462 /** Constant fold the various boolean binary ops.
01463  */
01464 static ConstExpr *
01465 lConstFoldBoolBinOp(BinaryExpr::Op op, const bool *v0, const bool *v1, 
01466                     ConstExpr *carg0) {
01467     bool result[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01468     int count = carg0->Count();
01469 
01470     switch (op) {
01471         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitAnd, &);
01472         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitXor, ^);
01473         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::BitOr, |);
01474         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Lt, <);
01475         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Gt, >);
01476         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Le, <=);
01477         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Ge, >=);
01478         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::Equal, ==);
01479         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::NotEqual, !=);
01480         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalAnd, &&);
01481         FOLD_OP(BinaryExpr::LogicalOr, ||);
01482     default:
01483         return NULL;
01484     }
01485 
01486     return new ConstExpr(carg0->GetType(), result, carg0->pos);
01487 }
01488 
01489 
01490 Expr *
01491 BinaryExpr::Optimize() {
01492     if (arg0 != NULL) 
01493         arg0 = arg0->Optimize();
01494     if (arg1 != NULL) 
01495         arg1 = arg1->Optimize();
01496 
01497     if (!arg0 || !arg1)
01498         return NULL;
01499 
01500     ConstExpr *constArg0 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg0);
01501     ConstExpr *constArg1 = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(arg1);
01502 
01503     if (g->opt.fastMath) {
01504         // optimizations related to division by floats..
01505 
01506         // transform x / const -> x * (1/const)
01507         if (op == Div && constArg1 != NULL) {
01508             const Type *type1 = constArg1->GetType();
01509             if (Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
01510                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::VaryingFloat) ||
01511                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::UniformConstFloat) ||
01512                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::VaryingConstFloat)) {
01513                 float inv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01514                 int count = constArg1->AsFloat(inv);
01515                 for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
01516                     inv[i] = 1.f / inv[i];
01517                 Expr *einv = new ConstExpr(type1, inv, constArg1->pos);
01518                 Expr *e = new BinaryExpr(Mul, arg0, einv, pos);
01519                 e = e->TypeCheck();
01520                 if (e == NULL)
01521                     return NULL;
01522                 return e->Optimize();
01523             }
01524         }
01525 
01526         // transform x / y -> x * rcp(y)
01527         if (op == Div) {
01528             const Type *type1 = arg1->GetType();
01529             if (Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::UniformFloat) ||
01530                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::VaryingFloat) ||
01531                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::UniformConstFloat) ||
01532                 Type::Equal(type1, AtomicType::VaryingConstFloat)) {
01533                 // Get the symbol for the appropriate builtin
01534                 std::vector<Symbol *> rcpFuns;
01535                 m->symbolTable->LookupFunction("rcp", &rcpFuns);
01536                 if (rcpFuns.size() > 0) {
01537                     Assert(rcpFuns.size() == 2);
01538                     Expr *rcpSymExpr = new FunctionSymbolExpr("rcp", rcpFuns, pos);
01539                     ExprList *args = new ExprList(arg1, arg1->pos);
01540                     Expr *rcpCall = new FunctionCallExpr(rcpSymExpr, args, 
01541                                                          arg1->pos);
01542                     rcpCall = rcpCall->TypeCheck();
01543                     if (rcpCall == NULL)
01544                         return NULL;
01545                     rcpCall = rcpCall->Optimize();
01546                     if (rcpCall == NULL)
01547                         return NULL;
01548 
01549                     Expr *ret = new BinaryExpr(Mul, arg0, rcpCall, pos);
01550                     ret = ret->TypeCheck();
01551                     if (ret == NULL)
01552                         return NULL;
01553                     return ret->Optimize();
01554                 }
01555                 else
01556                     Warning(pos, "rcp() not found from stdlib.  Can't apply "
01557                             "fast-math rcp optimization.");
01558             }
01559         }
01560     }
01561 
01562     // From here on out, we're just doing constant folding, so if both args
01563     // aren't constants then we're done...
01564     if (constArg0 == NULL || constArg1 == NULL)
01565         return this;
01566 
01567     Assert(Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arg0->GetType(), arg1->GetType()));
01568     const Type *type = arg0->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
01569     if (type == AtomicType::UniformFloat || type == AtomicType::VaryingFloat) {
01570         float v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01571         constArg0->AsFloat(v0);
01572         constArg1->AsFloat(v1);
01573         ConstExpr *ret;
01574         if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01575             return ret;
01576         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01577             return ret;
01578         else 
01579             return this;
01580     }
01581     if (type == AtomicType::UniformDouble || type == AtomicType::VaryingDouble) {
01582         double v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01583         constArg0->AsDouble(v0);
01584         constArg1->AsDouble(v1);
01585         ConstExpr *ret;
01586         if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01587             return ret;
01588         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01589             return ret;
01590         else 
01591             return this;
01592     }
01593     if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt32 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt32) {
01594         int32_t v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01595         constArg0->AsInt32(v0);
01596         constArg1->AsInt32(v1);
01597         ConstExpr *ret;
01598         if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01599             return ret;
01600         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinIntOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01601             return ret;
01602         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01603             return ret;
01604         else
01605             return this;
01606     }
01607     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt32 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 ||
01608              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
01609         uint32_t v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01610         constArg0->AsUInt32(v0);
01611         constArg1->AsUInt32(v1);
01612         ConstExpr *ret;
01613         if ((ret = lConstFoldBinArithOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01614             return ret;
01615         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinIntOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01616             return ret;
01617         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01618             return ret;
01619         else
01620             return this;
01621     }
01622     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformBool || type == AtomicType::VaryingBool) {
01623         bool v0[ISPC_MAX_NVEC], v1[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
01624         constArg0->AsBool(v0);
01625         constArg1->AsBool(v1);
01626         ConstExpr *ret;
01627         if ((ret = lConstFoldBoolBinOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01628             return ret;
01629         else if ((ret = lConstFoldBinLogicalOp(op, v0, v1, constArg0)) != NULL)
01630             return ret;
01631         else 
01632             return this;
01633     }
01634     else
01635         return this;
01636 }
01637 
01638 
01639 Expr *
01640 BinaryExpr::TypeCheck() {
01641     if (arg0 != NULL) 
01642         arg0 = arg0->TypeCheck();
01643     if (arg1 != NULL) 
01644         arg1 = arg1->TypeCheck();
01645 
01646     if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01647         return NULL;
01648 
01649     const Type *type0 = arg0->GetType(), *type1 = arg1->GetType();
01650     if (type0 == NULL || type1 == NULL)
01651         return NULL;
01652 
01653     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type0) != NULL) {
01654         arg0 = new DereferenceExpr(arg0, arg0->pos);
01655         type0 = arg0->GetType();
01656         Assert(type0 != NULL);
01657     }
01658     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(type1) != NULL) {
01659         arg1 = new DereferenceExpr(arg1, arg1->pos);
01660         type1 = arg1->GetType();
01661         Assert(type1 != NULL);
01662     }
01663 
01664     // Convert arrays to pointers to their first elements
01665     if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type0) != NULL) {
01666         arg0 = lArrayToPointer(arg0);
01667         type0 = arg0->GetType();
01668     }
01669     if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type1) != NULL) {
01670         arg1 = lArrayToPointer(arg1);
01671         type1 = arg1->GetType();
01672     }
01673 
01674     const PointerType *pt0 = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type0);
01675     const PointerType *pt1 = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type1);
01676     if (pt0 != NULL && pt1 != NULL && op == Sub) {
01677         if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(type0)) {
01678             Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
01679                   "on \"%s\" type.", type0->GetString().c_str());
01680             return NULL;
01681         }
01682         if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(type1)) {
01683             Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
01684                   "on \"%s\" type.", type1->GetString().c_str());
01685             return NULL;
01686         }
01687 
01688         const Type *t = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, pos, "-");
01689         if (t == NULL)
01690             return NULL;
01691         arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, t, "pointer subtraction");
01692         arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, t, "pointer subtraction");
01693         if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01694             return NULL;
01695 
01696         return this;
01697     }
01698     else if (((pt0 != NULL || pt1 != NULL) && op == Add) ||
01699              (pt0 != NULL && op == Sub)) {
01700         // Handle ptr + int, int + ptr, ptr - int
01701         if (pt0 != NULL && pt1 != NULL) {
01702             Error(pos, "Illegal to add two pointer types \"%s\" and \"%s\".",
01703                   pt0->GetString().c_str(), pt1->GetString().c_str());
01704             return NULL;
01705         }
01706         else if (pt1 != NULL) {
01707             // put in canonical order with the pointer as the first operand
01708             // for GetValue()
01709             std::swap(arg0, arg1);
01710             std::swap(type0, type1);
01711             std::swap(pt0, pt1);
01712         }
01713 
01714         Assert(pt0 != NULL);
01715 
01716         if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(pt0)) {
01717             Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic "
01718                   "on \"%s\" type.", pt0->GetString().c_str());
01719             return NULL;
01720         }
01721 
01722         const Type *offsetType = g->target.is32Bit ? 
01723             AtomicType::UniformInt32 : AtomicType::UniformInt64;
01724         if (pt0->IsVaryingType())
01725             offsetType = offsetType->GetAsVaryingType();
01726         if (type1->IsVaryingType()) {
01727             arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, type0->GetAsVaryingType(), 
01728                                    "pointer addition");
01729             Assert(arg0 != NULL);
01730         }
01731 
01732         arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, offsetType, lOpString(op));
01733         if (arg1 == NULL)
01734             return NULL;
01735 
01736         return this;
01737     }
01738 
01739     switch (op) {
01740     case Shl:
01741     case Shr:
01742     case BitAnd:
01743     case BitXor:
01744     case BitOr: {
01745         // Must have integer or bool-typed operands for these bit-related
01746         // ops; don't do any implicit conversions from floats here...
01747         if (!type0->IsIntType() && !type0->IsBoolType()) {
01748             Error(arg0->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" must be "
01749                   "an integer or bool.", lOpString(op));
01750             return NULL;
01751         }
01752         if (!type1->IsIntType() && !type1->IsBoolType()) {
01753             Error(arg1->pos, "Second operand to binary operator \"%s\" must be "
01754                   "an integer or bool.", lOpString(op));
01755             return NULL;
01756         }
01757 
01758         if (op == Shl || op == Shr) {
01759             bool isVarying = (type0->IsVaryingType() ||
01760                               type1->IsVaryingType());
01761             if (isVarying) {
01762                 arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, type0->GetAsVaryingType(), 
01763                                        "shift operator");
01764                 if (arg0 == NULL)
01765                     return NULL;
01766                 type0 = arg0->GetType();
01767             }
01768             arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, type0, "shift operator");
01769             if (arg1 == NULL)
01770                 return NULL;
01771         }
01772         else {
01773             const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos,
01774                                                              "binary bit op");
01775             if (promotedType == NULL)
01776                 return NULL;
01777 
01778             arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, promotedType, "binary bit op");
01779             arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, promotedType, "binary bit op");
01780             if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01781                 return NULL;
01782         }
01783         return this;
01784     }
01785     case Add:
01786     case Sub:
01787     case Mul:
01788     case Div:
01789     case Mod: {
01790         // Must be numeric type for these.  (And mod is special--can't be float)
01791         if (!type0->IsNumericType() || (op == Mod && type0->IsFloatType())) {
01792             Error(arg0->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of "
01793                   "invalid type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), 
01794                   type0->GetString().c_str());
01795             return NULL;
01796         }
01797         if (!type1->IsNumericType() || (op == Mod && type1->IsFloatType())) {
01798             Error(arg1->pos, "First operand to binary operator \"%s\" is of "
01799                   "invalid type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), 
01800                   type1->GetString().c_str());
01801             return NULL;
01802         }
01803 
01804         const Type *promotedType = Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos,
01805                                                          lOpString(op));
01806         if (promotedType == NULL)
01807             return NULL;
01808 
01809         arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, promotedType, lOpString(op));
01810         arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, promotedType, lOpString(op));
01811         if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01812             return NULL;
01813         return this;
01814     }
01815     case Lt:
01816     case Gt:
01817     case Le:
01818     case Ge:
01819     case Equal:
01820     case NotEqual: {
01821         const PointerType *pt0 = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type0);
01822         const PointerType *pt1 = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type1);
01823 
01824         // Convert '0' in expressions where the other expression is a
01825         // pointer type to a NULL pointer.
01826         if (pt0 != NULL && lIsAllIntZeros(arg1)) {
01827             arg1 = new NullPointerExpr(pos);
01828             type1 = arg1->GetType();
01829             pt1 = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type1);
01830         }
01831         else if (pt1 != NULL && lIsAllIntZeros(arg0)) {
01832             arg0 = new NullPointerExpr(pos);
01833             type0 = arg1->GetType();
01834             pt0 = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type0);
01835         }
01836 
01837         if (pt0 == NULL && pt1 == NULL) {
01838             if (!type0->IsBoolType() && !type0->IsNumericType()) {
01839                 Error(arg0->pos,
01840                       "First operand to operator \"%s\" is of "
01841                       "non-comparable type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), 
01842                       type0->GetString().c_str());
01843                 return NULL;
01844             }
01845             if (!type1->IsBoolType() && !type1->IsNumericType()) {
01846                 Error(arg1->pos,
01847                       "Second operand to operator \"%s\" is of "
01848                       "non-comparable type \"%s\".", lOpString(op), 
01849                       type1->GetString().c_str());
01850                 return NULL;
01851             }
01852         }
01853 
01854         const Type *promotedType = 
01855             Type::MoreGeneralType(type0, type1, arg0->pos, lOpString(op));
01856         if (promotedType == NULL)
01857             return NULL;
01858 
01859         arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, promotedType, lOpString(op));
01860         arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, promotedType, lOpString(op));
01861         if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01862             return NULL;
01863         return this;
01864     }
01865     case LogicalAnd:
01866     case LogicalOr: {
01867         // We need to type convert to a boolean type of the more general
01868         // shape of the two types
01869         bool isUniform = (type0->IsUniformType() && type1->IsUniformType());
01870         const AtomicType *boolType = isUniform ? AtomicType::UniformBool : 
01871                                                  AtomicType::VaryingBool;
01872         const Type *destType = NULL;
01873         const VectorType *vtype0 = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type0);
01874         const VectorType *vtype1 = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type1);
01875         if (vtype0 && vtype1) {
01876             int sz0 = vtype0->GetElementCount(), sz1 = vtype1->GetElementCount();
01877             if (sz0 != sz1) {
01878                 Error(pos, "Can't do logical operation \"%s\" between vector types of "
01879                       "different sizes (%d vs. %d).", lOpString(op), sz0, sz1);
01880                 return NULL;
01881             }
01882             destType = new VectorType(boolType, sz0);
01883         }
01884         else if (vtype0)
01885             destType = new VectorType(boolType, vtype0->GetElementCount());
01886         else if (vtype1)
01887             destType = new VectorType(boolType, vtype1->GetElementCount());
01888         else
01889             destType = boolType;
01890 
01891         arg0 = TypeConvertExpr(arg0, destType, lOpString(op));
01892         arg1 = TypeConvertExpr(arg1, destType, lOpString(op));
01893         if (arg0 == NULL || arg1 == NULL)
01894             return NULL;
01895         return this;
01896     }
01897     case Comma:
01898         return this;
01899     default:
01900         FATAL("logic error");
01901         return NULL;
01902     }
01903 }
01904 
01905 
01906 int
01907 BinaryExpr::EstimateCost() const {
01908     return ((arg0 ? arg0->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01909             (arg1 ? arg1->EstimateCost() : 0) +
01910             ((op == Div || op == Mod) ? COST_COMPLEX_ARITH_OP : 
01911                                         COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP));
01912 }
01913 
01914 
01915 void
01916 BinaryExpr::Print() const {
01917     if (!arg0 || !arg1 || !GetType())
01918         return;
01919 
01920     printf("[ %s ] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
01921     arg0->Print();
01922     printf(" %s ", lOpString(op));
01923     arg1->Print();
01924     printf(")");
01925     pos.Print();
01926 }
