01928 
01929 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
01930 // AssignExpr
01931 
01932 static const char *
01933 lOpString(AssignExpr::Op op) {
01934     switch (op) {
01935     case AssignExpr::Assign:    return "=";
01936     case AssignExpr::MulAssign: return "*=";
01937     case AssignExpr::DivAssign: return "/=";
01938     case AssignExpr::ModAssign: return "%%=";
01939     case AssignExpr::AddAssign: return "+=";
01940     case AssignExpr::SubAssign: return "-=";
01941     case AssignExpr::ShlAssign: return "<<=";
01942     case AssignExpr::ShrAssign: return ">>=";
01943     case AssignExpr::AndAssign: return "&=";
01944     case AssignExpr::XorAssign: return "^=";
01945     case AssignExpr::OrAssign:  return "|=";
01946     default:
01947         FATAL("Missing op in lOpstring");
01948         return "";
01949     }
01950 }
01951 
01952 /** Emit code to do an "assignment + operation" operator, e.g. "+=".
01953  */
01954 static llvm::Value *
01955 lEmitOpAssign(AssignExpr::Op op, Expr *arg0, Expr *arg1, const Type *type, 
01956               Symbol *baseSym, SourcePos pos, FunctionEmitContext *ctx) {
01957     llvm::Value *lv = arg0->GetLValue(ctx);
01958     if (!lv) {
01959         // FIXME: I think this test is unnecessary and that this case
01960         // should be caught during typechecking
01961         Error(pos, "Can't assign to left-hand side of expression.");
01962         return NULL;
01963     }
01964     const Type *lvalueType = arg0->GetLValueType();
01965     if (lvalueType == NULL)
01966         return NULL;
01967 
01968     // Get the value on the right-hand side of the assignment+operation
01969     // operator and load the current value on the left-hand side.
01970     llvm::Value *rvalue = arg1->GetValue(ctx);
01971     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
01972     llvm::Value *mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
01973     llvm::Value *oldLHS = ctx->LoadInst(lv, mask, lvalueType, "opassign_load");
01974 
01975     // Map the operator to the corresponding BinaryExpr::Op operator
01976     BinaryExpr::Op basicop;
01977     switch (op) {
01978     case AssignExpr::MulAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Mul;    break;
01979     case AssignExpr::DivAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Div;    break;
01980     case AssignExpr::ModAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Mod;    break;
01981     case AssignExpr::AddAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Add;    break;
01982     case AssignExpr::SubAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Sub;    break;
01983     case AssignExpr::ShlAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Shl;    break;
01984     case AssignExpr::ShrAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::Shr;    break;
01985     case AssignExpr::AndAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitAnd; break;
01986     case AssignExpr::XorAssign: basicop = BinaryExpr::BitXor; break;
01987     case AssignExpr::OrAssign:  basicop = BinaryExpr::BitOr;  break;
01988     default:
01989         FATAL("logic error in lEmitOpAssign()");
01990         return NULL;
01991     }
01992 
01993     // Emit the code to compute the new value
01994     llvm::Value *newValue = NULL;
01995     switch (op) {
01996     case AssignExpr::MulAssign:
01997     case AssignExpr::DivAssign:
01998     case AssignExpr::ModAssign:
01999     case AssignExpr::AddAssign:
02000     case AssignExpr::SubAssign:
02001         newValue = lEmitBinaryArith(basicop, oldLHS, rvalue, type,
02002                                     arg1->GetType(), ctx, pos);
02003         break;
02004     case AssignExpr::ShlAssign:
02005     case AssignExpr::ShrAssign:
02006     case AssignExpr::AndAssign:
02007     case AssignExpr::XorAssign:
02008     case AssignExpr::OrAssign:
02009         newValue = lEmitBinaryBitOp(basicop, oldLHS, rvalue, 
02010                                     arg0->GetType()->IsUnsignedType(), ctx);
02011         break;
02012     default:
02013         FATAL("logic error in lEmitOpAssign");
02014         return NULL;
02015     }
02016 
02017     // And store the result back to the lvalue.
02018     lStoreAssignResult(newValue, lv, lvalueType, ctx, baseSym);
02019 
02020     return newValue;
02021 }
02022 
02023 
02024 AssignExpr::AssignExpr(AssignExpr::Op o, Expr *a, Expr *b, SourcePos p) 
02025     : Expr(p), op(o) {
02026     lvalue = a;
02027     rvalue = b;
02028 }
02029 
02030 
02031 llvm::Value *
02032 AssignExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
02033     const Type *type = NULL;
02034     if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL || (type = GetType()) == NULL)
02035         return NULL;
02036 
02037     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02038 
02039     Symbol *baseSym = lvalue->GetBaseSymbol();
02040     // Should be caught during type-checking...
02041     assert(baseSym != NULL);
02042 
02043     switch (op) {
02044     case Assign: {
02045         llvm::Value *lv = lvalue->GetLValue(ctx);
02046         if (lv == NULL) {
02047             Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
02048             return NULL;
02049         }
02050         const Type *lvalueType = lvalue->GetLValueType();
02051         if (lvalueType == NULL) {
02052             Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
02053             return NULL;
02054         }
02055 
02056         llvm::Value *rv = rvalue->GetValue(ctx);
02057         if (rv == NULL) {
02058             Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
02059             return NULL;
02060         }
02061 
02062         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02063 
02064         lStoreAssignResult(rv, lv, lvalueType, ctx, baseSym);
02065 
02066         return rv;
02067     }
02068     case MulAssign:
02069     case DivAssign:
02070     case ModAssign:
02071     case AddAssign:
02072     case SubAssign:
02073     case ShlAssign:
02074     case ShrAssign:
02075     case AndAssign:
02076     case XorAssign:
02077     case OrAssign: {
02078         // This should be caught during type checking
02079         Assert(!dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type) &&
02080                !dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type));
02081         return lEmitOpAssign(op, lvalue, rvalue, type, baseSym, pos, ctx);
02082     }
02083     default:
02084         FATAL("logic error in AssignExpr::GetValue()");
02085         return NULL;
02086     }
02087 }
02088 
02089 
02090 Expr *
02091 AssignExpr::Optimize() {
02092     if (lvalue) 
02093         lvalue = lvalue->Optimize();
02094     if (rvalue) 
02095         rvalue = rvalue->Optimize();
02096     if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL)
02097         return NULL;
02098 
02099     return this;
02100 }
02101 
02102 
02103 const Type *
02104 AssignExpr::GetType() const {
02105     return lvalue ? lvalue->GetType() : NULL;
02106 }
02107 
02108 
02109 /** Recursively checks a structure type to see if it (or any struct type
02110     that it holds) has a const-qualified member. */
02111 static bool
02112 lCheckForConstStructMember(SourcePos pos, const StructType *structType,
02113                            const StructType *initialType) {
02114     for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
02115         const Type *t = structType->GetElementType(i);
02116         if (t->IsConstType()) {
02117             if (structType == initialType)
02118                 Error(pos, "Illegal to assign to type \"%s\" due to element "
02119                       "\"%s\" with type \"%s\".", structType->GetString().c_str(),
02120                       structType->GetElementName(i).c_str(),
02121                       t->GetString().c_str());
02122             else
02123                 Error(pos, "Illegal to assign to type \"%s\" in type \"%s\" "
02124                       "due to element \"%s\" with type \"%s\".", 
02125                       structType->GetString().c_str(),
02126                       initialType->GetString().c_str(), 
02127                       structType->GetElementName(i).c_str(),
02128                       t->GetString().c_str());
02129             return true;
02130         }
02131 
02132         const StructType *st = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(t);
02133         if (st != NULL && lCheckForConstStructMember(pos, st, initialType))
02134             return true;
02135     }
02136     return false;
02137 }
02138 
02139 
02140 Expr *
02141 AssignExpr::TypeCheck() {
02142     if (lvalue != NULL) 
02143         lvalue = lvalue->TypeCheck();
02144     if (rvalue != NULL) 
02145         rvalue = rvalue->TypeCheck();
02146     if (lvalue == NULL || rvalue == NULL) 
02147         return NULL;
02148 
02149     bool lvalueIsReference = 
02150         dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(lvalue->GetType()) != NULL;
02151     if (lvalueIsReference)
02152         lvalue = new DereferenceExpr(lvalue, lvalue->pos);
02153 
02154     FunctionSymbolExpr *fse;
02155     if ((fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(rvalue)) != NULL) {
02156         // Special case to use the type of the LHS to resolve function
02157         // overloads when we're assigning a function pointer where the
02158         // function is overloaded.
02159         const Type *lvalueType = lvalue->GetType();
02160         const FunctionType *ftype;
02161         if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(lvalueType) == NULL ||
02162             (ftype = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(lvalueType->GetBaseType())) == NULL) {
02163             Error(pos, "Can't assign function pointer to type \"%s\".",
02164                   lvalue->GetType()->GetString().c_str());
02165             return NULL;
02166         }
02167 
02168         std::vector<const Type *> paramTypes;
02169         for (int i = 0; i < ftype->GetNumParameters(); ++i)
02170             paramTypes.push_back(ftype->GetParameterType(i));
02171 
02172         if (!fse->ResolveOverloads(rvalue->pos, paramTypes)) {
02173             Error(pos, "Unable to find overloaded function for function "
02174                   "pointer assignment.");
02175             return NULL;
02176         }
02177     }
02178 
02179     if (lvalue->GetBaseSymbol() == NULL) {
02180         Error(lvalue->pos, "Left hand side of assignment statement can't be "
02181               "assigned to.");
02182         return NULL;
02183     }
02184 
02185     const Type *lhsType = lvalue->GetType();
02186     if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(lhsType) != NULL) {
02187         if (op == AddAssign || op == SubAssign) {
02188             if (PointerType::IsVoidPointer(lhsType)) {
02189                 Error(pos, "Illegal to perform pointer arithmetic on \"%s\" "
02190                       "type.", lhsType->GetString().c_str());
02191                 return NULL;
02192             }
02193 
02194             const Type *deltaType = g->target.is32Bit ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 :
02195                 AtomicType::UniformInt64;
02196             if (lhsType->IsVaryingType())
02197                 deltaType = deltaType->GetAsVaryingType();
02198             rvalue = TypeConvertExpr(rvalue, deltaType, lOpString(op));
02199         }
02200         else if (op == Assign)
02201             rvalue = TypeConvertExpr(rvalue, lhsType, "assignment");
02202         else {
02203             Error(pos, "Assignment operator \"%s\" is illegal with pointer types.",
02204                   lOpString(op));
02205             return NULL;
02206         }
02207     }
02208     else if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(lhsType) != NULL) {
02209         Error(pos, "Illegal to assign to array type \"%s\".",
02210               lhsType->GetString().c_str());
02211         return NULL;
02212     }
02213     else
02214         rvalue = TypeConvertExpr(rvalue, lhsType, lOpString(op));
02215 
02216     if (rvalue == NULL)
02217         return NULL;
02218 
02219     if (lhsType->IsConstType()) {
02220         Error(pos, "Can't assign to type \"%s\" on left-hand side of "
02221               "expression.", lhsType->GetString().c_str());
02222         return NULL;
02223     }
02224 
02225     // Make sure we're not assigning to a struct that has a constant member
02226     const StructType *st = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(lhsType);
02227     if (st != NULL && lCheckForConstStructMember(pos, st, st))
02228         return NULL;
02229 
02230     return this;
02231 }
02232 
02233 
02234 int
02235 AssignExpr::EstimateCost() const {
02236     int cost = ((lvalue ? lvalue->EstimateCost() : 0) +
02237                 (rvalue ? rvalue->EstimateCost() : 0));
02238     cost += COST_ASSIGN;
02239     if (op == Assign)
02240         return cost;
02241     if (op == DivAssign || op == ModAssign)
02242         return cost + COST_COMPLEX_ARITH_OP;
02243     else
02244         return cost + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
02245 }
02246 
02247 
02248 void
02249 AssignExpr::Print() const {
02250     if (!lvalue || !rvalue || !GetType())
02251         return;
02252 
02253     printf("[%s] assign (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
02254     lvalue->Print();
02255     printf(" %s ", lOpString(op));
02256     rvalue->Print();
02257     printf(")");
02258     pos.Print();
02259 }

02261 
02262 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02263 // SelectExpr
02264 
02265 SelectExpr::SelectExpr(Expr *t, Expr *e1, Expr *e2, SourcePos p) 
02266     : Expr(p) {
02267     test = t;
02268     expr1 = e1;
02269     expr2 = e2;
02270 }
02271 
02272 
02273 /** Emit code to select between two varying values based on a varying test
02274     value.
02275  */
02276 static llvm::Value *
02277 lEmitVaryingSelect(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *test, 
02278                    llvm::Value *expr1, llvm::Value *expr2, 
02279                    const Type *type) {
02280     llvm::Value *resultPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(expr1->getType(), "selectexpr_tmp");
02281     // Don't need to worry about masking here
02282     ctx->StoreInst(expr2, resultPtr);
02283     // Use masking to conditionally store the expr1 values
02284     Assert(resultPtr->getType() ==
02285            PointerType::GetUniform(type)->LLVMType(g->ctx));
02286     ctx->StoreInst(expr1, resultPtr, test, PointerType::GetUniform(type));
02287     return ctx->LoadInst(resultPtr, "selectexpr_final");
02288 }
02289 
02290 
02291 llvm::Value *
02292 SelectExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
02293     if (!expr1 || !expr2 || !test)
02294         return NULL;
02295 
02296     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02297 
02298     const Type *testType = test->GetType()->GetAsNonConstType();
02299     // This should be taken care of during typechecking
02300     Assert(testType->GetBaseType() == AtomicType::UniformBool ||
02301            testType->GetBaseType() == AtomicType::VaryingBool);
02302 
02303     const Type *type = expr1->GetType();
02304 
02305     if (testType == AtomicType::UniformBool) {
02306         // Simple case of a single uniform bool test expression; we just
02307         // want one of the two expressions.  In this case, we can be
02308         // careful to evaluate just the one of the expressions that we need
02309         // the value of so that if the other one has side-effects or
02310         // accesses invalid memory, it doesn't execute.
02311         llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
02312         llvm::BasicBlock *testTrue = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_true");
02313         llvm::BasicBlock *testFalse = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_false");
02314         llvm::BasicBlock *testDone = ctx->CreateBasicBlock("select_done");
02315         ctx->BranchInst(testTrue, testFalse, testVal);
02316 
02317         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testTrue);
02318         llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
02319         // Note that truePred won't be necessarily equal to testTrue, in
02320         // case the expr1->GetValue() call changes the current basic block.
02321         llvm::BasicBlock *truePred = ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock();
02322         ctx->BranchInst(testDone);
02323 
02324         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testFalse);
02325         llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
02326         // See comment above truePred for why we can't just assume we're in
02327         // the testFalse basic block here.
02328         llvm::BasicBlock *falsePred = ctx->GetCurrentBasicBlock();
02329         ctx->BranchInst(testDone);
02330 
02331         ctx->SetCurrentBasicBlock(testDone);
02332         llvm::PHINode *ret = ctx->PhiNode(expr1Val->getType(), 2, "select");
02333         ret->addIncoming(expr1Val, truePred);
02334         ret->addIncoming(expr2Val, falsePred);
02335         return ret;
02336     }
02337     else if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType) == NULL) {
02338         // if the test is a varying bool type, then evaluate both of the
02339         // value expressions with the mask set appropriately and then do an
02340         // element-wise select to get the result
02341         llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
02342         Assert(testVal->getType() == LLVMTypes::MaskType);
02343         llvm::Value *oldMask = ctx->GetInternalMask();
02344         ctx->SetInternalMaskAnd(oldMask, testVal);
02345         llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
02346         ctx->SetInternalMaskAndNot(oldMask, testVal);
02347         llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
02348         ctx->SetInternalMask(oldMask);
02349 
02350         return lEmitVaryingSelect(ctx, testVal, expr1Val, expr2Val, type);
02351     }
02352     else {
02353         // FIXME? Short-circuiting doesn't work in the case of
02354         // vector-valued test expressions.  (We could also just prohibit
02355         // these and place the issue in the user's hands...)
02356         llvm::Value *testVal = test->GetValue(ctx);
02357         llvm::Value *expr1Val = expr1->GetValue(ctx);
02358         llvm::Value *expr2Val = expr2->GetValue(ctx);
02359 
02360         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02361         const VectorType *vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type);
02362         // Things that typechecking should have caught
02363         Assert(vt != NULL);
02364         Assert(dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType) != NULL &&
02365                (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType)->GetElementCount() == 
02366                 vt->GetElementCount()));
02367 
02368         // Do an element-wise select  
02369         llvm::Value *result = llvm::UndefValue::get(type->LLVMType(g->ctx));
02370         for (int i = 0; i < vt->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
02371             llvm::Value *ti = ctx->ExtractInst(testVal, i);
02372             llvm::Value *e1i = ctx->ExtractInst(expr1Val, i);
02373             llvm::Value *e2i = ctx->ExtractInst(expr2Val, i);
02374             llvm::Value *sel = NULL;
02375             if (testType->IsUniformType())
02376                 sel = ctx->SelectInst(ti, e1i, e2i);
02377             else
02378                 sel = lEmitVaryingSelect(ctx, ti, e1i, e2i, vt->GetElementType());
02379             result = ctx->InsertInst(result, sel, i);
02380         }
02381         return result;
02382     }
02383 }
02384 
02385 
02386 const Type *
02387 SelectExpr::GetType() const {
02388     if (!test || !expr1 || !expr2)
02389         return NULL;
02390 
02391     const Type *testType = test->GetType();
02392     const Type *expr1Type = expr1->GetType();
02393     const Type *expr2Type = expr2->GetType();
02394 
02395     if (!testType || !expr1Type || !expr2Type)
02396         return NULL;
02397 
02398     bool becomesVarying = (testType->IsVaryingType() || expr1Type->IsVaryingType() ||
02399                            expr2Type->IsVaryingType());
02400     // if expr1 and expr2 have different vector sizes, typechecking should fail...
02401     int testVecSize = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType) != NULL ?
02402         dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType)->GetElementCount() : 0;
02403     int expr1VecSize = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(expr1Type) != NULL ?
02404         dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(expr1Type)->GetElementCount() : 0;
02405     Assert(!(testVecSize != 0 && expr1VecSize != 0 && testVecSize != expr1VecSize));
02406     
02407     int vectorSize = std::max(testVecSize, expr1VecSize);
02408     return Type::MoreGeneralType(expr1Type, expr2Type, Union(expr1->pos, expr2->pos),
02409                                  "select expression", becomesVarying, vectorSize);
02410 }
02411 
02412 
02413 Expr *
02414 SelectExpr::Optimize() {
02415     if (test) 
02416         test = test->Optimize();
02417     if (expr1) 
02418         expr1 = expr1->Optimize();
02419     if (expr2) 
02420         expr2 = expr2->Optimize();
02421     if (test == NULL || expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
02422         return NULL;
02423 
02424     return this;
02425 }
02426 
02427 
02428 Expr *
02429 SelectExpr::TypeCheck() {
02430     if (test) 
02431         test = test->TypeCheck();
02432     if (expr1) 
02433         expr1 = expr1->TypeCheck();
02434     if (expr2) 
02435         expr2 = expr2->TypeCheck();
02436 
02437     if (test == NULL || expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
02438         return NULL;
02439 
02440     const Type *type1 = expr1->GetType(), *type2 = expr2->GetType();
02441     if (!type1 || !type2)
02442         return NULL;
02443 
02444     if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type1)) {
02445         Error(pos, "Array type \"%s\" can't be used in select expression", 
02446               type1->GetString().c_str());
02447         return NULL;
02448     }
02449     if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type2)) {
02450         Error(pos, "Array type \"%s\" can't be used in select expression", 
02451               type2->GetString().c_str());
02452         return NULL;
02453     }
02454 
02455     const Type *testType = test->GetType();
02456     if (testType == NULL)
02457         return NULL;
02458     test = TypeConvertExpr(test, lMatchingBoolType(testType), "select");
02459     if (test == NULL)
02460         return NULL;
02461     testType = test->GetType();
02462 
02463     int testVecSize = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType) ?
02464         dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(testType)->GetElementCount() : 0;
02465     const Type *promotedType = 
02466         Type::MoreGeneralType(type1, type2, Union(expr1->pos, expr2->pos),
02467                               "select expression", testType->IsVaryingType(), testVecSize);
02468     if (promotedType == NULL)
02469         return NULL;
02470 
02471     expr1 = TypeConvertExpr(expr1, promotedType, "select");
02472     expr2 = TypeConvertExpr(expr2, promotedType, "select");
02473     if (expr1 == NULL || expr2 == NULL)
02474         return NULL;
02475 
02476     return this;
02477 }
02478 
02479 
02480 int
02481 SelectExpr::EstimateCost() const {
02482     return COST_SELECT;
02483 }
02484 
02485 
02486 void
02487 SelectExpr::Print() const {
02488     if (!test || !expr1 || !expr2 || !GetType())
02489         return;
02490 
02491     printf("[%s] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
02492     test->Print();
02493     printf(" ? ");
02494     expr1->Print();
02495     printf(" : ");
02496     expr2->Print();
02497     printf(")");
02498     pos.Print();
02499 }
02500 
02501 
02502 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02503 // FunctionCallExpr
02504 
02505 FunctionCallExpr::FunctionCallExpr(Expr *f, ExprList *a, SourcePos p, 
02506                                    bool il, Expr *lce) 
02507     : Expr(p), isLaunch(il) {
02508     func = f;
02509     args = a;
02510     launchCountExpr = lce;
02511 }
02512 
02513 
02514 static const FunctionType *
02515 lGetFunctionType(Expr *func) {
02516     if (func == NULL)
02517         return NULL;
02518 
02519     const Type *type = func->GetType();
02520     if (type == NULL)
02521         return NULL;
02522 
02523     const FunctionType *ftype = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(type);
02524     if (ftype == NULL) {
02525         // Not a regular function symbol--is it a function pointer?
02526         if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type) != NULL)
02527             ftype = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(type->GetBaseType());
02528     }
02529     return ftype;
02530 }
02531 
02532 
02533 llvm::Value *
02534 FunctionCallExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
02535     if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
02536         return NULL;
02537 
02538     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02539 
02540     llvm::Value *callee = func->GetValue(ctx);
02541 
02542     if (callee == NULL) {
02543         Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
02544         return NULL;
02545     }
02546 
02547     const FunctionType *ft = lGetFunctionType(func);
02548     Assert(ft != NULL);
02549     bool isVoidFunc = (ft->GetReturnType() == AtomicType::Void);
02550 
02551     // Automatically convert function call args to references if needed.
02552     // FIXME: this should move to the TypeCheck() method... (but the
02553     // GetLValue call below needs a FunctionEmitContext, which is
02554     // problematic...)  
02555     std::vector<Expr *> callargs = args->exprs;
02556     bool err = false;
02557 
02558     // Specifically, this can happen if there's an error earlier during
02559     // overload resolution.
02560     if ((int)callargs.size() > ft->GetNumParameters()) {
02561         Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
02562         return NULL;
02563     }
02564 
02565     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < callargs.size(); ++i) {
02566         Expr *argExpr = callargs[i];
02567         if (argExpr == NULL)
02568             continue;
02569 
02570         const Type *paramType = ft->GetParameterType(i); 
02571 
02572         const Type *argLValueType = argExpr->GetLValueType();
02573         if (argLValueType != NULL &&
02574             dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(argLValueType) != NULL &&
02575             argLValueType->IsVaryingType() &&
02576             dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(paramType) != NULL) {
02577             Error(argExpr->pos, "Illegal to pass a \"varying\" lvalue to a "
02578                   "reference parameter of type \"%s\".",
02579                   paramType->GetString().c_str());
02580             return NULL;
02581         }
02582 
02583         // Do whatever type conversion is needed
02584         argExpr = TypeConvertExpr(argExpr, paramType,
02585                                   "function call argument");
02586         if (argExpr == NULL)
02587             return NULL;
02588         callargs[i] = argExpr;
02589     }
02590     if (err)
02591         return NULL;
02592 
02593     // Fill in any default argument values needed.
02594     // FIXME: should we do this during type checking?
02595     for (int i = callargs.size(); i < ft->GetNumParameters(); ++i) {
02596         Expr *paramDefault = ft->GetParameterDefault(i);
02597         const Type *paramType = ft->GetParameterType(i);
02598         // FIXME: this type conv should happen when we create the function
02599         // type!
02600         Expr *d = TypeConvertExpr(paramDefault, paramType,
02601                                   "function call default argument");
02602         if (d == NULL)
02603             return NULL;
02604         callargs.push_back(d);
02605     }
02606 
02607     // Now evaluate the values of all of the parameters being passed.
02608     std::vector<llvm::Value *> argVals;
02609     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < callargs.size(); ++i) {
02610         Expr *argExpr = callargs[i];
02611         if (argExpr == NULL)
02612             // give up; we hit an error earlier
02613             return NULL;
02614 
02615         llvm::Value *argValue = argExpr->GetValue(ctx);
02616         if (argValue == NULL)
02617             // something went wrong in evaluating the argument's
02618             // expression, so give up on this
02619             return NULL;
02620 
02621         argVals.push_back(argValue);
02622     }
02623 
02624 
02625     llvm::Value *retVal = NULL;
02626     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
02627     if (ft->isTask) {
02628         Assert(launchCountExpr != NULL);
02629         llvm::Value *launchCount = launchCountExpr->GetValue(ctx);
02630         if (launchCount != NULL)
02631             ctx->LaunchInst(callee, argVals, launchCount);
02632     }
02633     else
02634         retVal = ctx->CallInst(callee, ft, argVals, 
02635                                isVoidFunc ? "" : "calltmp");
02636 
02637     if (isVoidFunc)
02638         return NULL;
02639     else
02640         return retVal;
02641 }
02642 
02643 
02644 const Type *
02645 FunctionCallExpr::GetType() const {
02646     const FunctionType *ftype = lGetFunctionType(func);
02647     return ftype ? ftype->GetReturnType() : NULL;
02648 }
02649 
02650 
02651 Expr *
02652 FunctionCallExpr::Optimize() {
02653     if (func) 
02654         func = func->Optimize();
02655     if (args) 
02656         args = args->Optimize();
02657     if (launchCountExpr != NULL)
02658         launchCountExpr = launchCountExpr->Optimize();
02659 
02660     if (!func || !args)
02661         return NULL;
02662         
02663     return this;
02664 }
02665 
02666 
02667 Expr *
02668 FunctionCallExpr::TypeCheck() {
02669     if (func != NULL)
02670         func = func->TypeCheck();
02671     if (args != NULL) 
02672         args = args->TypeCheck();
02673     if (launchCountExpr != NULL)
02674         launchCountExpr = launchCountExpr->TypeCheck();
02675 
02676     if (args != NULL && func != NULL) {
02677         std::vector<const Type *> argTypes;
02678         std::vector<bool> argCouldBeNULL;
02679         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < args->exprs.size(); ++i) {
02680             if (args->exprs[i] == NULL)
02681                 return NULL;
02682             const Type *t = args->exprs[i]->GetType();
02683             if (t == NULL)
02684                 return NULL;
02685             argTypes.push_back(t);
02686             argCouldBeNULL.push_back(lIsAllIntZeros(args->exprs[i]));
02687         }
02688 
02689         FunctionSymbolExpr *fse = dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func);
02690         if (fse != NULL) {
02691             // Regular function call
02692 
02693             if (fse->ResolveOverloads(args->pos, argTypes, &argCouldBeNULL) == false)
02694                 return NULL;
02695 
02696             func = fse->TypeCheck();
02697             if (func == NULL)
02698                 return NULL;
02699 
02700             const PointerType *pt = 
02701                 dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(func->GetType());
02702             const FunctionType *ft = (pt == NULL) ? NULL : 
02703                 dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(pt->GetBaseType());
02704             if (ft == NULL) {
02705                 Error(pos, "Valid function name must be used for function call.");
02706                 return NULL;
02707             }
02708 
02709             if (ft->isTask) {
02710                 if (!isLaunch)
02711                     Error(pos, "\"launch\" expression needed to call function "
02712                           "with \"task\" qualifier.");
02713                 if (!launchCountExpr)
02714                     return NULL;
02715 
02716                 launchCountExpr = 
02717                     TypeConvertExpr(launchCountExpr, AtomicType::UniformInt32,
02718                                     "task launch count");
02719                 if (launchCountExpr == NULL)
02720                     return NULL;
02721             }
02722             else {
02723                 if (isLaunch)
02724                     Error(pos, "\"launch\" expression illegal with non-\"task\"-"
02725                           "qualified function.");
02726                 Assert(launchCountExpr == NULL);
02727             }
02728         }
02729         else {
02730             // Call through a function pointer
02731             const Type *fptrType = func->GetType();
02732             if (fptrType == NULL)
02733                 return NULL;
02734            
02735             Assert(dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(fptrType) != NULL);
02736             const FunctionType *funcType = 
02737                 dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(fptrType->GetBaseType());
02738             if (funcType == NULL) {
02739                 Error(pos, "Must provide function name or function pointer for "
02740                       "function call expression.");
02741                 return NULL;
02742             }
02743             
02744             // Make sure we don't have too many arguments for the function
02745             if ((int)argTypes.size() > funcType->GetNumParameters()) {
02746                 Error(args->pos, "Too many parameter values provided in "
02747                       "function call (%d provided, %d expected).",
02748                       (int)argTypes.size(), funcType->GetNumParameters());
02749                 return NULL;
02750             }
02751             // It's ok to have too few arguments, as long as the function's
02752             // default parameter values have started by the time we run out
02753             // of arguments
02754             if ((int)argTypes.size() < funcType->GetNumParameters() &&
02755                 funcType->GetParameterDefault(argTypes.size()) == NULL) {
02756                 Error(args->pos, "Too few parameter values provided in "
02757                       "function call (%d provided, %d expected).",
02758                       (int)argTypes.size(), funcType->GetNumParameters());
02759                 return NULL;
02760             }
02761 
02762             // Now make sure they can all type convert to the corresponding
02763             // parameter types..
02764             for (int i = 0; i < (int)argTypes.size(); ++i) {
02765                 if (i < funcType->GetNumParameters()) {
02766                     // make sure it can type convert
02767                     const Type *paramType = funcType->GetParameterType(i);
02768                     if (CanConvertTypes(argTypes[i], paramType) == false &&
02769                         !(argCouldBeNULL[i] == true &&
02770                           dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(paramType) != NULL)) {
02771                         Error(args->exprs[i]->pos, "Can't convert argument of "
02772                               "type \"%s\" to type \"%s\" for funcion call "
02773                               "argument.", argTypes[i]->GetString().c_str(),
02774                               paramType->GetString().c_str());
02775                         return NULL;
02776                     }
02777                 }
02778                 else
02779                     // Otherwise the parameter default saves us.  It should
02780                     // be there for sure, given the check right above the
02781                     // for loop.
02782                     Assert(funcType->GetParameterDefault(i) != NULL);
02783             }
02784 
02785             if (fptrType->IsVaryingType() && 
02786                 funcType->GetReturnType()->IsUniformType()) {
02787                 Error(pos, "Illegal to call a varying function pointer that "
02788                       "points to a function with a uniform return type.");
02789                 return NULL;
02790             }
02791         }
02792     }
02793 
02794     if (func == NULL || args == NULL)
02795         return NULL;
02796     return this;
02797 }
02798 
02799 
02800 int
02801 FunctionCallExpr::EstimateCost() const {
02802     int callCost = 0;
02803     if (isLaunch) {
02804         callCost = COST_TASK_LAUNCH;
02805         if (launchCountExpr != NULL)
02806             callCost += launchCountExpr->EstimateCost();
02807     }
02808     else if (dynamic_cast<FunctionSymbolExpr *>(func) == NULL) {
02809         // it's going through a function pointer
02810         const Type *fpType = func->GetType();
02811         if (fpType != NULL) {
02812             Assert(dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(fpType) != NULL);
02813             if (fpType->IsUniformType())
02814                 callCost = COST_FUNPTR_UNIFORM;
02815             else 
02816                 callCost = COST_FUNPTR_VARYING;
02817         }
02818     }
02819     else
02820         // regular function call
02821         callCost = COST_FUNCALL;
02822 
02823     return (args ? args->EstimateCost() : 0) + callCost;
02824 }
02825 
02826 
02827 void
02828 FunctionCallExpr::Print() const {
02829     if (!func || !args || !GetType())
02830         return;
02831 
02832     printf("[%s] funcall %s ", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
02833            isLaunch ? "launch" : "");
02834     func->Print();
02835     printf(" args (");
02836     args->Print();
02837     printf(")");
02838     pos.Print();
02839 }

02862         if (exprs[i])
02863             exprs[i] = exprs[i]->Optimize();
02864     return this;
02865 }

02868 ExprList *
02869 ExprList::TypeCheck() {
02870     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i)
02871         if (exprs[i])
02872             exprs[i] = exprs[i]->TypeCheck();
02873     return this;
02874 }
02875 
02876 
02877 llvm::Constant *
02878 ExprList::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
02879     if (exprs.size() == 1 &&
02880         (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL ||
02881          dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL ||
02882          dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type) != NULL))
02883         return exprs[0]->GetConstant(type);
02884 
02885     const CollectionType *collectionType = 
02886         dynamic_cast<const CollectionType *>(type);
02887     if (collectionType == NULL)
02888         return NULL;
02889 
02890     std::string name;
02891     if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type) != NULL)
02892         name = "struct";
02893     else if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(type) != NULL) 
02894         name = "array";
02895     else if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(type) != NULL) 
02896         name = "vector";
02897     else 
02898         FATAL("Unexpected CollectionType in ExprList::GetConstant()");
02899 
02900     if ((int)exprs.size() != collectionType->GetElementCount()) {
02901         Error(pos, "Initializer list for %s \"%s\" must have %d elements "
02902               "(has %d).", name.c_str(), collectionType->GetString().c_str(),
02903               collectionType->GetElementCount(), (int)exprs.size());
02904         return NULL;
02905     }
02906 
02907     std::vector<llvm::Constant *> cv;
02908     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
02909         if (exprs[i] == NULL)
02910             return NULL;
02911         const Type *elementType = collectionType->GetElementType(i);
02912         llvm::Constant *c = exprs[i]->GetConstant(elementType);
02913         if (c == NULL)
02914             // If this list element couldn't convert to the right constant
02915             // type for the corresponding collection member, then give up.
02916             return NULL;
02917         cv.push_back(c);
02918     }
02919 
02920     if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(type) != NULL) {
02921 #if defined(LLVM_2_9)
02922         return llvm::ConstantStruct::get(*g->ctx, cv, false);
02923 #else
02924         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::StructType *llvmStructType =
02925             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::StructType>(collectionType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
02926         Assert(llvmStructType != NULL);
02927         return llvm::ConstantStruct::get(llvmStructType, cv);
02928 #endif
02929     }
02930     else {
02931         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *lt = type->LLVMType(g->ctx);
02932         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType *lat = 
02933             llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::ArrayType>(lt);
02934         // FIXME: should the assert below validly fail for uniform vectors
02935         // now?  Need a test case to reproduce it and then to be sure we
02936         // have the right fix; leave the assert until we can hit it...
02937         Assert(lat != NULL);
02938         return llvm::ConstantArray::get(lat, cv);
02939     }
02940     return NULL;
02941 }
02942 
02943 
02944 int
02945 ExprList::EstimateCost() const {
02946     int cost = 0;
02947     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
02948         if (exprs[i] != NULL)
02949             cost += exprs[i]->EstimateCost();
02950     }
02951     return cost;
02952 }
02953 
02954 
02955 void
02956 ExprList::Print() const {
02957     printf("expr list (");
02958     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < exprs.size(); ++i) {
02959         if (exprs[i] != NULL)
02960             exprs[i]->Print();
02961         printf("%s", (i == exprs.size() - 1) ? ")" : ", ");
02962     }
02963     pos.Print();
02964 }
02965 
02966 
02967 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
02968 // IndexExpr
02969 
02970 IndexExpr::IndexExpr(Expr *a, Expr *i, SourcePos p) 
02971     : Expr(p) {
02972     baseExpr = a;
02973     index = i;
02974 }
02975 
02976 
02977 /** When computing pointer values, we need to apply a per-lane offset when
02978     we have a varying pointer that is itself indexing into varying data.
02979     Consdier the following ispc code:
02980 
02981     uniform float u[] = ...;
02982     float v[] = ...;
02983     int index = ...;
02984     float a = u[index];
02985     float b = v[index];
02986 
02987     To compute the varying pointer that holds the addresses to load from
02988     for u[index], we basically just need to multiply index element-wise by
02989     sizeof(float) before doing the memory load.  For v[index], we need to
02990     do the same scaling but also need to add per-lane offsets <0,
02991     sizeof(float), 2*sizeof(float), ...> so that the i'th lane loads the
02992     i'th of the varying values at its index value.  
02993 
02994     This function handles figuring out when this additional offset is
02995     needed and then incorporates it in the varying pointer value.
02996  */ 
02997 static llvm::Value *
02998 lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *ptr, 
02999                            const Type *ptrType) {
03000     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(ptrType) != NULL)
03001         // References are uniform pointers, so no offsetting is needed
03002         return ptr;
03003 
03004     Assert(dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(ptrType) != NULL);
03005     if (ptrType->IsUniformType())
03006         return ptr;
03007 
03008     const Type *baseType = ptrType->GetBaseType();
03009     if (baseType->IsUniformType())
03010         return ptr;
03011 
03012     // must be indexing into varying atomic, enum, or pointer types
03013     if (dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(baseType) == NULL &&
03014         dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(baseType) == NULL &&
03015         dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(baseType) == NULL)
03016         return ptr;
03017 
03018     // Onward: compute the per lane offsets.
03019     llvm::Value *varyingOffsets = 
03020         llvm::UndefValue::get(LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType);
03021     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
03022         varyingOffsets = ctx->InsertInst(varyingOffsets, LLVMInt32(i), i,
03023                                          "varying_delta");
03024 
03025     // And finally add the per-lane offsets.  Note that we lie to the GEP
03026     // call and tell it that the pointers are to uniform elements and not
03027     // varying elements, so that the offsets in terms of (0,1,2,...) will
03028     // end up turning into the correct step in bytes...
03029     const Type *uniformElementType = baseType->GetAsUniformType();
03030     const Type *ptrUnifType = PointerType::GetVarying(uniformElementType);
03031     return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(ptr, varyingOffsets, ptrUnifType);
03032 }
03033 
03034 
03035 llvm::Value *
03036 IndexExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
03037     const Type *baseExprType;
03038     if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL || 
03039         ((baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType()) == NULL))
03040         return NULL;
03041 
03042     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03043 
03044     llvm::Value *lvalue = GetLValue(ctx);
03045     llvm::Value *mask = NULL;
03046     const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
03047     if (lvalue == NULL) {
03048         // We may be indexing into a temporary that hasn't hit memory, so
03049         // get the full value and stuff it into temporary alloca'd space so
03050         // that we can index from there...
03051         llvm::Value *val = baseExpr->GetValue(ctx);
03052         if (val == NULL) {
03053             Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
03054             return NULL;
03055         }
03056         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03057         llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(baseExprType->LLVMType(g->ctx), 
03058                                            "array_tmp");
03059         ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
03060 
03061         lvalue = ctx->GetElementPtrInst(ptr, LLVMInt32(0), index->GetValue(ctx),
03062                                         PointerType::GetUniform(baseExprType));
03063 
03064         const SequentialType *st = 
03065             dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(baseExprType);
03066         if (st == NULL) {
03067             Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
03068             return NULL;
03069         }
03070         lvalueType = PointerType::GetUniform(st->GetElementType());
03071 
03072         lvalue = lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, lvalue, lvalueType);
03073                                             
03074         mask = LLVMMaskAllOn;
03075     }
03076     else {
03077         Symbol *baseSym = GetBaseSymbol();
03078         Assert(baseSym != NULL);
03079         mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
03080     }
03081 
03082     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03083     return ctx->LoadInst(lvalue, mask, lvalueType, "index");
03084 }
03085 
03086 
03087 const Type *
03088 IndexExpr::GetType() const {
03089     const Type *baseExprType, *indexType;
03090     if (!baseExpr || !index || 
03091         ((baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType()) == NULL) ||
03092         ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL))
03093         return NULL;
03094 
03095     const Type *elementType = NULL;
03096     const PointerType *pointerType = 
03097         dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(baseExprType);
03098     if (pointerType != NULL)
03099         // ptr[index] -> type that the pointer points to
03100         elementType = pointerType->GetBaseType();
03101     else {
03102         // sequential type[index] -> element type of the sequential type
03103         const SequentialType *sequentialType = 
03104             dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(baseExprType->GetReferenceTarget());
03105         // Typechecking should have caught this...
03106         Assert(sequentialType != NULL);
03107         elementType = sequentialType->GetElementType();
03108     }
03109 
03110     if (indexType->IsUniformType())
03111         // If the index is uniform, the resulting type is just whatever the
03112         // element type is
03113         return elementType;
03114     else
03115         // A varying index into even a uniform base type -> varying type
03116         return elementType->GetAsVaryingType();
03117 }
03118 
03119 
03120 Symbol *
03121 IndexExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
03122     return baseExpr ? baseExpr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
03123 }
03124 
03125 
03126 llvm::Value *
03127 IndexExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
03128     const Type *baseExprType;
03129     if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL || 
03130         ((baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType()) == NULL))
03131         return NULL;
03132 
03133     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03134     if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(baseExprType) != NULL) {
03135         // We're indexing off of a base pointer 
03136         llvm::Value *baseValue = baseExpr->GetValue(ctx);
03137         llvm::Value *indexValue = index->GetValue(ctx);
03138         if (baseValue == NULL || indexValue == NULL)
03139             return NULL;
03140         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03141         return ctx->GetElementPtrInst(baseValue, indexValue,
03142                                       baseExprType, "ptr_offset");
03143     }
03144 
03145     // Otherwise it's an array or vector
03146     llvm::Value *basePtr = NULL;
03147     const Type *basePtrType = NULL;
03148     if (dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(baseExprType) ||
03149         dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(baseExprType)) {
03150         basePtr = baseExpr->GetLValue(ctx);
03151         basePtrType = baseExpr->GetLValueType();
03152     }
03153     else {
03154         baseExprType = baseExprType->GetReferenceTarget();
03155         Assert(dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(baseExprType) ||
03156                dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(baseExprType));
03157         basePtr = baseExpr->GetValue(ctx);
03158         basePtrType = baseExpr->GetType();
03159     }
03160     if (!basePtr)
03161         return NULL;
03162 
03163     // If the array index is a compile time constant, check to see if it
03164     // may lead to an out-of-bounds access.
03165     ConstExpr *ce = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(index);
03166     const SequentialType *seqType = 
03167         dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(baseExprType);
03168     if (seqType != NULL) {
03169         int nElements = seqType->GetElementCount();
03170         if (ce != NULL && nElements > 0) {
03171             int32_t indices[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
03172             int count = ce->AsInt32(indices);
03173             for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i) {
03174                 if (indices[i] < 0 || indices[i] >= nElements)
03175                     Warning(index->pos, "Array index \"%d\" may be out of bounds for "
03176                             "%d element array.", indices[i], nElements);
03177             }
03178         }
03179     }
03180 
03181     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03182     llvm::Value *ptr = 
03183         ctx->GetElementPtrInst(basePtr, LLVMInt32(0), index->GetValue(ctx),
03184                                basePtrType);
03185     ptr = lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, GetLValueType());
03186     return ptr;
03187 }
03188 
03189 
03190 const Type *
03191 IndexExpr::GetLValueType() const {
03192     const Type *baseExprLValueType, *indexType;
03193     if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL || 
03194         ((baseExprLValueType = baseExpr->GetLValueType()) == NULL) ||
03195         ((indexType = index->GetType()) == NULL))
03196         return NULL;
03197 
03198     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(baseExprLValueType) != NULL)
03199         baseExprLValueType = PointerType::GetUniform(baseExprLValueType->GetReferenceTarget());
03200     Assert(dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(baseExprLValueType) != NULL);
03201 
03202     // FIXME: can we do something in the type system that unifies the
03203     // concept of a sequential type's element type and a pointer type's
03204     // base type?  The code below is identical but for handling that
03205     // difference.  IndexableType?
03206     const SequentialType *st = 
03207         dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(baseExprLValueType->GetBaseType());
03208     if (st != NULL) {
03209         if (baseExprLValueType->IsUniformType() && indexType->IsUniformType())
03210             return PointerType::GetUniform(st->GetElementType());
03211         else
03212             return PointerType::GetVarying(st->GetElementType());
03213     }
03214 
03215     const PointerType *pt = 
03216         dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(baseExprLValueType->GetBaseType());
03217     Assert(pt != NULL);
03218     if (baseExprLValueType->IsUniformType() && indexType->IsUniformType())
03219         return PointerType::GetUniform(pt->GetBaseType());
03220     else
03221         return PointerType::GetVarying(pt->GetBaseType());
03222 }
03223 
03224 
03225 Expr *
03226 IndexExpr::Optimize() {
03227     if (baseExpr) 
03228         baseExpr = baseExpr->Optimize();
03229     if (index) 
03230         index = index->Optimize();
03231     if (baseExpr == NULL || index == NULL)
03232         return NULL;
03233 
03234     return this;
03235 }
03236 
03237 
03238 Expr *
03239 IndexExpr::TypeCheck() {
03240     if (baseExpr) 
03241         baseExpr = baseExpr->TypeCheck();
03242     if (index) 
03243         index = index->TypeCheck();
03244     
03245     if (!baseExpr || !index || !index->GetType())
03246         return NULL;
03247 
03248     const Type *baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType();
03249     if (!baseExprType)
03250         return NULL;
03251 
03252     if (!dynamic_cast<const SequentialType *>(baseExprType->GetReferenceTarget()) &&
03253         !dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(baseExprType)) {
03254         Error(pos, "Trying to index into non-array, vector, or pointer "
03255               "type \"%s\".", baseExprType->GetString().c_str());
03256         return NULL;
03257     }
03258 
03259     bool isUniform = (index->GetType()->IsUniformType() && 
03260                       !g->opt.disableUniformMemoryOptimizations);
03261     const Type *indexType = isUniform ? AtomicType::UniformInt32 : 
03262                                         AtomicType::VaryingInt32;
03263     index = TypeConvertExpr(index, indexType, "array index");
03264     if (index == NULL)
03265         return NULL;
03266 
03267     return this;
03268 }
03269 
03270 
03271 int
03272 IndexExpr::EstimateCost() const {
03273     if (index == NULL || baseExpr == NULL)
03274         return 0;
03275 
03276     const Type *indexType = index->GetType();
03277     const Type *baseExprType = baseExpr->GetType();
03278     
03279     if ((indexType != NULL && indexType->IsVaryingType()) ||
03280         (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(baseExprType) != NULL &&
03281          baseExprType->IsVaryingType()))
03282         // be pessimistic; some of these will later turn out to be vector
03283         // loads/stores, but it's too early for us to know that here.
03284         return COST_GATHER;
03285     else
03286         return COST_LOAD;
03287 }
03288 
03289 
03290 void
03291 IndexExpr::Print() const {
03292     if (!baseExpr || !index || !GetType())
03293         return;
03294 
03295     printf("[%s] index ", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
03296     baseExpr->Print();
03297     printf("[");
03298     index->Print();
03299     printf("]");
03300     pos.Print();
03301 }
03302 
03303 
03304 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
03305 // MemberExpr
03306 
03307 /** Map one character ids to vector element numbers.  Allow a few different
03308     conventions--xyzw, rgba, uv.
03309 */
03310 static int
03311 lIdentifierToVectorElement(char id) {
03312     switch (id) {
03313     case 'x':
03314     case 'r':
03315     case 'u':
03316         return 0;
03317     case 'y':
03318     case 'g':
03319     case 'v':
03320         return 1;
03321     case 'z':
03322     case 'b':
03323         return 2;
03324     case 'w':
03325     case 'a':
03326         return 3;
03327     default:
03328         return -1;
03329     }
03330 }
03331 
03332 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
03333 // StructMemberExpr
03334 
03335 class StructMemberExpr : public MemberExpr
03336 {
03337 public:
03338     StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03339                      SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue);
03340 
03341     const Type *GetType() const;
03342     int getElementNumber() const;
03343     const Type *getElementType() const;
03344 
03345 private:
03346     const StructType *getStructType() const;
03347 };
03348 
03349 
03350 StructMemberExpr::StructMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03351                                    SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue)
03352     : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue) {
03353 }
03354 
03355 
03356 const Type *
03357 StructMemberExpr::GetType() const {
03358     // It's a struct, and the result type is the element type, possibly
03359     // promoted to varying if the struct type / lvalue is varying.
03360     const StructType *structType = getStructType();
03361     if (structType == NULL)
03362         return NULL;
03363 
03364     const Type *elementType = structType->GetElementType(identifier);
03365     if (elementType == NULL) {
03366         Error(identifierPos,
03367               "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s",
03368               identifier.c_str(), structType->GetString().c_str(),
03369               getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
03370         return NULL;
03371     }
03372 
03373     const PointerType *pt = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(expr->GetType());
03374     if (structType->IsVaryingType() ||
03375         (pt != NULL && pt->IsVaryingType()))
03376         return elementType->GetAsVaryingType();
03377     else
03378         return elementType;
03379 }
03380 
03381 
03382 int
03383 StructMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
03384     const StructType *structType = getStructType();
03385     if (structType == NULL)
03386         return -1;
03387 
03388     int elementNumber = structType->GetElementNumber(identifier);
03389     if (elementNumber == -1)
03390         Error(identifierPos,
03391               "Element name \"%s\" not present in struct type \"%s\".%s",
03392               identifier.c_str(), structType->GetString().c_str(),
03393               getCandidateNearMatches().c_str());
03394     return elementNumber;
03395 }
03396 
03397 
03398 const Type *
03399 StructMemberExpr::getElementType() const {
03400     const StructType *structType = getStructType();
03401     if (structType == NULL)
03402         return NULL;
03403 
03404     return structType->GetAsUniformType()->GetElementType(identifier);
03405 }
03406 
03407 
03408 const StructType *
03409 StructMemberExpr::getStructType() const {
03410     const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
03411     if (exprType == NULL)
03412         return NULL;
03413     
03414     const StructType *structType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(exprType);
03415     if (structType == NULL) {
03416         const PointerType *pt = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(exprType);
03417         if (pt != NULL)
03418             structType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(pt->GetBaseType());
03419         else {
03420             const ReferenceType *rt = 
03421                 dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(exprType);
03422             Assert(rt != NULL);
03423             structType = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(rt->GetReferenceTarget());
03424         }
03425         Assert(structType != NULL);
03426     }
03427     return structType;
03428 }

03430 
03431 //////////////////////////////////////////////////
03432 // VectorMemberExpr
03433 
03434 class VectorMemberExpr : public MemberExpr
03435 {
03436 public:
03437     VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03438                      SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue);
03439 
03440     llvm::Value *GetValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const;
03441     llvm::Value *GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const;
03442     const Type *GetType() const;
03443     const Type *GetLValueType() const;
03444 
03445     int getElementNumber() const;
03446     const Type *getElementType() const;
03447 
03448 private:
03449     const VectorType *exprVectorType;
03450     const VectorType *memberType;
03451 };
03452 
03453 
03454 VectorMemberExpr::VectorMemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p,
03455                                    SourcePos idpos, bool derefLValue)
03456     : MemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue) {
03457     const Type *exprType = e->GetType();
03458     exprVectorType = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(exprType);
03459     if (exprVectorType == NULL) {
03460         const PointerType *pt = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(exprType);
03461         if (pt != NULL)
03462             exprVectorType = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(pt->GetBaseType());
03463         else {
03464             Assert(dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(exprType) != NULL);
03465             exprVectorType = 
03466                 dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(exprType->GetReferenceTarget());
03467         }
03468         Assert(exprVectorType != NULL);
03469     }
03470     memberType = new VectorType(exprVectorType->GetElementType(),
03471                                 identifier.length());
03472 }
03473 
03474 
03475 const Type *
03476 VectorMemberExpr::GetType() const {
03477     // For 1-element expressions, we have the base vector element
03478     // type.  For n-element expressions, we have a shortvec type
03479     // with n > 1 elements.  This can be changed when we get
03480     // type<1> -> type conversions.
03481     const Type *type = (identifier.length() == 1) ? 
03482         (const Type *)exprVectorType->GetElementType() : 
03483         (const Type *)memberType;
03484 
03485     const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
03486     if (lvalueType != NULL && lvalueType->IsVaryingType())
03487         type = type->GetAsVaryingType();
03488     return type;
03489 }
03490 
03491 
03492 llvm::Value *
03493 VectorMemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext* ctx) const {
03494     if (identifier.length() == 1) {
03495         return MemberExpr::GetLValue(ctx);
03496     } else {
03497         return NULL;
03498     }
03499 }
03500 
03501 
03502 const Type *
03503 VectorMemberExpr::GetLValueType() const {
03504     if (identifier.length() == 1) {
03505         if (expr == NULL)
03506             return NULL;
03507 
03508         const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
03509             expr->GetLValueType();
03510         if (exprLValueType == NULL)
03511             return NULL;
03512 
03513         const VectorType *vt = NULL;
03514         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(exprLValueType) != NULL)
03515             vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(exprLValueType->GetReferenceTarget());
03516         else
03517             vt = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(exprLValueType->GetBaseType());
03518         Assert(vt != NULL);
03519 
03520         // we don't want to report that it's e.g. a pointer to a float<1>,
03521         // but ta pointer to a float, etc.
03522         const Type *elementType = vt->GetElementType();
03523         if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(exprLValueType) != NULL)
03524             return new ReferenceType(elementType);
03525         else
03526             return exprLValueType->IsUniformType() ?
03527                 PointerType::GetUniform(elementType) : 
03528                 PointerType::GetVarying(elementType);
03529     }
03530     else
03531         return NULL;
03532 }
03533 
03534 
03535 llvm::Value *
03536 VectorMemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
03537     if (identifier.length() == 1) {
03538         return MemberExpr::GetValue(ctx);
03539     } 
03540     else {
03541         std::vector<int> indices;
03542 
03543         for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
03544             int idx = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[i]);
03545             if (idx == -1)
03546                 Error(pos,
03547                       "Invalid swizzle charcter '%c' in swizzle \"%s\".",
03548                       identifier[i], identifier.c_str());
03549 
03550             indices.push_back(idx);
03551         }
03552 
03553         llvm::Value *basePtr = NULL;
03554         const Type *basePtrType = NULL;
03555         if (dereferenceExpr) {
03556             basePtr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
03557             basePtrType = expr->GetType();
03558         }
03559         else {
03560             basePtr = expr->GetLValue(ctx);
03561             basePtrType = expr->GetLValueType();
03562         }
03563 
03564         if (basePtr == NULL || basePtrType == NULL) {
03565             Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
03566             return NULL;
03567         }
03568 
03569         // Allocate temporary memory to tore the result
03570         llvm::Value *resultPtr = ctx->AllocaInst(memberType->LLVMType(g->ctx), 
03571                                             "vector_tmp");
03572 
03573         // FIXME: we should be able to use the internal mask here according
03574         // to the same logic where it's used elsewhere
03575         llvm::Value *elementMask = ctx->GetFullMask();
03576 
03577         const Type *elementPtrType = basePtrType->IsUniformType() ? 
03578             PointerType::GetUniform(exprVectorType->GetElementType()) :
03579             PointerType::GetVarying(exprVectorType->GetElementType());
03580 
03581         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03582         for (size_t i = 0; i < identifier.size(); ++i) {
03583             llvm::Value *elementPtr = ctx->AddElementOffset(basePtr, indices[i],
03584                                                             basePtrType);
03585             llvm::Value *elementValue = 
03586                 ctx->LoadInst(elementPtr, elementMask, elementPtrType, 
03587                               "vec_element");
03588 
03589             llvm::Value *ptmp = ctx->AddElementOffset(resultPtr, i, NULL);
03590             ctx->StoreInst(elementValue, ptmp);
03591         }
03592 
03593         return ctx->LoadInst(resultPtr, "swizzle_vec");
03594     }
03595 }
03596 
03597 
03598 int
03599 VectorMemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
03600     int elementNumber = lIdentifierToVectorElement(identifier[0]);
03601     if (elementNumber == -1)
03602         Error(pos, "Vector element identifier \"%s\" unknown.", 
03603               identifier.c_str());
03604     return elementNumber;
03605 }
03606 
03607 
03608 const Type *
03609 VectorMemberExpr::getElementType() const {
03610     return memberType;
03611 }
03612 
03613 
03614 
03615 MemberExpr *
03616 MemberExpr::create(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos,
03617                    bool derefLValue) {
03618     const Type *exprType;
03619     if (e == NULL || (exprType = e->GetType()) == NULL)
03620         return NULL;
03621 
03622     const ReferenceType *referenceType =
03623         dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(exprType);
03624     if (referenceType != NULL) {
03625         e = new DereferenceExpr(e, e->pos);
03626         exprType = e->GetType();
03627         Assert(exprType != NULL);
03628     }
03629 
03630     const PointerType *pointerType = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(exprType);
03631     if (pointerType != NULL)
03632         exprType = pointerType->GetBaseType();
03633 
03634     if (derefLValue == true && pointerType == NULL) {
03635         if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(exprType->GetReferenceTarget()) != NULL)
03636             Error(p, "Dereference operator \"->\" can't be applied to non-pointer "
03637                   "type \"%s\".  Did you mean to use \".\"?", 
03638                   exprType->GetString().c_str());
03639         else
03640             Error(p, "Dereference operator \"->\" can't be applied to non-struct "
03641                   "pointer type \"%s\".", exprType->GetString().c_str());
03642         return NULL;
03643     }
03644     if (derefLValue == false && pointerType != NULL &&
03645         dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(pointerType->GetBaseType()) != NULL) {
03646             Error(p, "Member operator \".\" can't be applied to pointer "
03647                   "type \"%s\".  Did you mean to use \"->\"?", 
03648                   exprType->GetString().c_str());
03649         return NULL;
03650     }
03651 
03652     if (dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(exprType) != NULL)
03653         return new StructMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue);
03654     else if (dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(exprType) != NULL)
03655         return new VectorMemberExpr(e, id, p, idpos, derefLValue);
03656     else {
03657         Error(p, "Member operator \"%s\" can't be used with expression of "
03658               "\"%s\" type.", derefLValue ? "->" : ".", 
03659               exprType->GetString().c_str());
03660         return NULL;
03661     }
03662 }
03663 
03664 
03665 MemberExpr::MemberExpr(Expr *e, const char *id, SourcePos p, SourcePos idpos,
03666                        bool derefLValue) 
03667     : Expr(p), identifierPos(idpos) {
03668     expr = e;
03669     identifier = id;
03670     dereferenceExpr = derefLValue;
03671 }
03672 
03673 
03674 llvm::Value *
03675 MemberExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
03676     if (!expr) 
03677         return NULL;
03678 
03679     llvm::Value *lvalue = GetLValue(ctx);
03680     const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
03681 
03682     llvm::Value *mask = NULL;
03683     if (lvalue == NULL) {
03684         // As in the array case, this may be a temporary that hasn't hit
03685         // memory; get the full value and stuff it into a temporary array
03686         // so that we can index from there...
03687         llvm::Value *val = expr->GetValue(ctx);
03688         if (!val) {
03689             Assert(m->errorCount > 0);
03690             return NULL;
03691         }
03692         ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03693         const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
03694         llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AllocaInst(exprType->LLVMType(g->ctx), 
03695                                            "struct_tmp");
03696         ctx->StoreInst(val, ptr);
03697 
03698         int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
03699         if (elementNumber == -1)
03700             return NULL;
03701 
03702         lvalue = ctx->AddElementOffset(ptr, elementNumber, 
03703                                        PointerType::GetUniform(exprType));
03704         lvalueType = PointerType::GetUniform(GetType());
03705         mask = LLVMMaskAllOn;
03706     }
03707     else {
03708         Symbol *baseSym = GetBaseSymbol();
03709         Assert(baseSym != NULL);
03710         mask = lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx);
03711     }
03712 
03713     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03714     return ctx->LoadInst(lvalue, mask, lvalueType, "structelement");
03715 }
03716 
03717 
03718 const Type *
03719 MemberExpr::GetType() const {
03720     return NULL;
03721 }
03722 
03723 
03724 Symbol *
03725 MemberExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
03726     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
03727 }
03728 
03729 
03730 int
03731 MemberExpr::getElementNumber() const {
03732     return -1;
03733 }
03734 
03735 
03736 llvm::Value *
03737 MemberExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
03738     const Type *exprType;
03739     if (!expr || ((exprType = expr->GetType()) == NULL))
03740         return NULL;
03741 
03742     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03743     llvm::Value *basePtr = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetValue(ctx) :
03744         expr->GetLValue(ctx);
03745     if (!basePtr)
03746         return NULL;
03747 
03748     int elementNumber = getElementNumber();
03749     if (elementNumber == -1)
03750         return NULL;
03751 
03752     const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
03753         expr->GetLValueType();
03754     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
03755     llvm::Value *ptr = ctx->AddElementOffset(basePtr, elementNumber,
03756                                              exprLValueType);
03757 
03758     ptr = lAddVaryingOffsetsIfNeeded(ctx, ptr, GetLValueType());
03759 
03760     return ptr;
03761 }
03762 
03763 
03764 const Type *
03765 MemberExpr::GetLValueType() const {
03766     if (expr == NULL)
03767         return NULL;
03768 
03769     const Type *exprLValueType = dereferenceExpr ? expr->GetType() :
03770         expr->GetLValueType();
03771     if (exprLValueType == NULL)
03772         return NULL;
03773 
03774     return exprLValueType->IsUniformType() ?
03775         PointerType::GetUniform(getElementType()) : 
03776         PointerType::GetVarying(getElementType());
03777 }
03778 
03779 
03780 Expr *
03781 MemberExpr::TypeCheck() {
03782     if (expr) 
03783         expr = expr->TypeCheck();
03784     return expr ? this : NULL;
03785 }
03786 
03787 
03788 Expr *
03789 MemberExpr::Optimize() {
03790     if (expr) 
03791         expr = expr->Optimize();
03792     return expr ? this : NULL;
03793 }
03794 
03795 
03796 int
03797 MemberExpr::EstimateCost() const {
03798     const Type *lvalueType = GetLValueType();
03799     if (lvalueType != NULL && lvalueType->IsVaryingType())
03800         return COST_GATHER + COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
03801     else
03802         return COST_SIMPLE_ARITH_LOGIC_OP;
03803 }
03804 
03805 
03806 void
03807 MemberExpr::Print() const {
03808     if (!expr || !GetType())
03809         return;
03810 
03811     printf("[%s] member (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
03812     expr->Print();
03813     printf(" . %s)", identifier.c_str());
03814     pos.Print();
03815 }
03816 
03817 
03818 /** There is no structure member with the name we've got in "identifier".
03819     Use the approximate string matching routine to see if the identifier is
03820     a minor misspelling of one of the ones that is there.
03821  */
03822 std::string
03823 MemberExpr::getCandidateNearMatches() const {
03824     const StructType *structType = 
03825         dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(expr->GetType());
03826     if (!structType)
03827         return "";
03828 
03829     std::vector<std::string> elementNames;
03830     for (int i = 0; i < structType->GetElementCount(); ++i)
03831         elementNames.push_back(structType->GetElementName(i));
03832     std::vector<std::string> alternates = MatchStrings(identifier, elementNames);
03833     if (!alternates.size())
03834         return "";
03835 
03836     std::string ret = " Did you mean ";
03837     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < alternates.size(); ++i) {
03838         ret += std::string("\"") + alternates[i] + std::string("\"");
03839         if (i < alternates.size() - 1) ret += ", or ";
03840     }
03841     ret += "?";
03842     return ret;
03843 }
