04070 
04071 
04072 ConstExpr::ConstExpr(ConstExpr *old, double *v) 
04073     : Expr(old->pos) {
04074     type = old->type;
04075 
04076     AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
04077 
04078     switch (basicType) {
04079     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04080         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
04081             boolVal[i] = (v[i] != 0.);
04082         break;
04083     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04084         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
04085             int8Val[i] = (int)v[i];
04086         break;
04087     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04088         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
04089             uint8Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
04090         break;
04091     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04092         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
04093             int16Val[i] = (int)v[i];
04094         break;
04095     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04096         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
04097             uint16Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
04098         break;
04099     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04100         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
04101             int32Val[i] = (int)v[i];
04102         break;
04103     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04104         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
04105             uint32Val[i] = (unsigned int)v[i];
04106         break;
04107     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04108         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
04109             floatVal[i] = (float)v[i];
04110         break;
04111     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04112         for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i)
04113             doubleVal[i] = v[i];
04114         break;
04115     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04116     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04117         // For now, this should never be reached 
04118         FATAL("fixme; we need another constructor so that we're not trying to pass "
04119                "double values to init an int64 type...");
04120     default:
04121         FATAL("unimplemented const type");
04122     }
04123 }
04124 
04125 
04126 AtomicType::BasicType
04127 ConstExpr::getBasicType() const {
04128     const AtomicType *at = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type);
04129     if (at != NULL)
04130         return at->basicType;
04131     else {
04132         Assert(dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL);
04133         return AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
04134     }
04135 }
04136 
04137 
04138 const Type *
04139 ConstExpr::GetType() const { 
04140     return type; 
04141 }
04142 
04143 
04144 llvm::Value *
04145 ConstExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
04146     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
04147     bool isVarying = type->IsVaryingType();
04148 
04149     AtomicType::BasicType basicType = getBasicType();
04150 
04151     switch (basicType) {
04152     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04153         if (isVarying)
04154             return LLVMBoolVector(boolVal);
04155         else
04156             return boolVal[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
04157     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04158         return isVarying ? LLVMInt8Vector(int8Val) : 
04159                            LLVMInt8(int8Val[0]);
04160     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04161         return isVarying ? LLVMUInt8Vector(uint8Val) : 
04162                            LLVMUInt8(uint8Val[0]);
04163     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04164         return isVarying ? LLVMInt16Vector(int16Val) : 
04165                            LLVMInt16(int16Val[0]);
04166     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04167         return isVarying ? LLVMUInt16Vector(uint16Val) : 
04168                            LLVMUInt16(uint16Val[0]);
04169     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04170         return isVarying ? LLVMInt32Vector(int32Val) : 
04171                            LLVMInt32(int32Val[0]);
04172     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04173         return isVarying ? LLVMUInt32Vector(uint32Val) : 
04174                            LLVMUInt32(uint32Val[0]);
04175     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04176         return isVarying ? LLVMFloatVector(floatVal) : 
04177                            LLVMFloat(floatVal[0]);
04178     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04179         return isVarying ? LLVMInt64Vector(int64Val) : 
04180                            LLVMInt64(int64Val[0]);
04181     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04182         return isVarying ? LLVMUInt64Vector(uint64Val) : 
04183                            LLVMUInt64(uint64Val[0]);
04184     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04185         return isVarying ? LLVMDoubleVector(doubleVal) : 
04186                            LLVMDouble(doubleVal[0]);
04187     default:
04188         FATAL("unimplemented const type");
04189         return NULL;
04190     }
04191 }
04192 
04193 
04194 /* Type conversion templates: take advantage of C++ function overloading
04195    rules to get the one we want to match. */
04196 
04197 /* First the most general case, just use C++ type conversion if nothing
04198    else matches */
04199 template <typename From, typename To> static inline void
04200 lConvertElement(From from, To *to) {
04201     *to = (To)from;
04202 }
04203 
04204 
04205 /** When converting from bool types to numeric types, make sure the result
04206     is one or zero.
04207  */ 
04208 template <typename To> static inline void
04209 lConvertElement(bool from, To *to) {
04210     *to = from ? (To)1 : (To)0;
04211 }
04212 
04213 
04214 /** When converting numeric types to bool, compare to zero.  (Do we
04215     actually need this one??) */
04216 template <typename From> static inline void
04217 lConvertElement(From from, bool *to) {
04218     *to = (from != 0);
04219 }
04220 
04221 
04222 /** And bool -> bool is just assignment */
04223 static inline void
04224 lConvertElement(bool from, bool *to) {
04225     *to = from;
04226 }
04227 
04228 
04229 /** Type conversion utility function
04230  */
04231 template <typename From, typename To> static void
04232 lConvert(const From *from, To *to, int count, bool forceVarying) {
04233     for (int i = 0; i < count; ++i)
04234         lConvertElement(from[i], &to[i]);
04235 
04236     if (forceVarying && count == 1)
04237         for (int i = 1; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
04238             to[i] = to[0];
04239 }
04240 
04241 
04242 int
04243 ConstExpr::AsInt64(int64_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
04244     switch (getBasicType()) {
04245     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:   lConvert(boolVal,   ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04246     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:   lConvert(int8Val,   ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04247     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:  lConvert(uint8Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04248     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:  lConvert(int16Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04249     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04250     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:  lConvert(int32Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04251     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04252     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:  lConvert(floatVal,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04253     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04254     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:  lConvert(int64Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04255     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04256     default:
04257         FATAL("unimplemented const type");
04258     }
04259     return Count();
04260 }

04347 int
04348 ConstExpr::AsInt8(int8_t *ip, bool forceVarying) const {
04349     switch (getBasicType()) {
04350     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:   lConvert(boolVal,   ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04351     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:   lConvert(int8Val,   ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04352     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:  lConvert(uint8Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04353     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:  lConvert(int16Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04354     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: lConvert(uint16Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04355     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:  lConvert(int32Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04356     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: lConvert(uint32Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04357     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:  lConvert(floatVal,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04358     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04359     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:  lConvert(int64Val,  ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04360     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: lConvert(uint64Val, ip, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04361     default:
04362         FATAL("unimplemented const type");
04363     }
04364     return Count();
04365 }

04378     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:  lConvert(floatVal,  up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04379     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: lConvert(doubleVal, up, Count(), forceVarying); break;
04380     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:  lConvert(int64Val,  up, Count(), forceVarying); break;

04471 
04472 
04473 int
04474 ConstExpr::Count() const { 
04475     return GetType()->IsVaryingType() ? g->target.vectorWidth : 1; 
04476 }
04477 
04478 
04479 llvm::Constant *
04480 ConstExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
04481     // Caller shouldn't be trying to stuff a varying value here into a
04482     // constant type.
04483     if (type->IsUniformType())
04484         Assert(Count() == 1);
04485 
04486     type = type->GetAsNonConstType();
04487     if (type == AtomicType::UniformBool || type == AtomicType::VaryingBool) {
04488         bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04489         AsBool(bv, type->IsVaryingType());
04490         if (type->IsUniformType())
04491             return bv[0] ? LLVMTrue : LLVMFalse;
04492         else
04493             return LLVMBoolVector(bv);
04494     }
04495     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt8 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt8) {
04496         int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04497         AsInt8(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
04498         if (type->IsUniformType())
04499             return LLVMInt8(iv[0]);
04500         else
04501             return LLVMInt8Vector(iv);
04502     }
04503     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt8 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt8 ||
04504              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
04505         uint8_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04506         AsUInt8(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
04507         if (type->IsUniformType())
04508             return LLVMUInt8(uiv[0]);
04509         else
04510             return LLVMUInt8Vector(uiv);
04511     }
04512     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt16 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt16) {
04513         int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04514         AsInt16(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
04515         if (type->IsUniformType())
04516             return LLVMInt16(iv[0]);
04517         else
04518             return LLVMInt16Vector(iv);
04519     }
04520     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt16 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt16 ||
04521              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
04522         uint16_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04523         AsUInt16(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
04524         if (type->IsUniformType())
04525             return LLVMUInt16(uiv[0]);
04526         else
04527             return LLVMUInt16Vector(uiv);
04528     }
04529     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt32 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt32) {
04530         int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04531         AsInt32(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
04532         if (type->IsUniformType())
04533             return LLVMInt32(iv[0]);
04534         else
04535             return LLVMInt32Vector(iv);
04536     }
04537     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt32 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt32 ||
04538              dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(type) != NULL) {
04539         uint32_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04540         AsUInt32(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
04541         if (type->IsUniformType())
04542             return LLVMUInt32(uiv[0]);
04543         else
04544             return LLVMUInt32Vector(uiv);
04545     }
04546     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformFloat || type == AtomicType::VaryingFloat) {
04547         float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04548         AsFloat(fv, type->IsVaryingType());
04549         if (type->IsUniformType())
04550             return LLVMFloat(fv[0]);
04551         else
04552             return LLVMFloatVector(fv);
04553     }
04554     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformInt64 || type == AtomicType::VaryingInt64) {
04555         int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04556         AsInt64(iv, type->IsVaryingType());
04557         if (type->IsUniformType())
04558             return LLVMInt64(iv[0]);
04559         else
04560             return LLVMInt64Vector(iv);
04561     }
04562     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformUInt64 || type == AtomicType::VaryingUInt64) {
04563         uint64_t uiv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04564         AsUInt64(uiv, type->IsVaryingType());
04565         if (type->IsUniformType())
04566             return LLVMUInt64(uiv[0]);
04567         else
04568             return LLVMUInt64Vector(uiv);
04569     }
04570     else if (type == AtomicType::UniformDouble || type == AtomicType::VaryingDouble) {
04571         double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
04572         AsDouble(dv, type->IsVaryingType());
04573         if (type->IsUniformType())
04574             return LLVMDouble(dv[0]);
04575         else
04576             return LLVMDoubleVector(dv);
04577     }
04578     else {
04579         FATAL("unexpected type in ConstExpr::GetConstant()");
04580         return NULL;
04581     }
04582 }

04593     return this;

04598 ConstExpr::EstimateCost() const {
04599     return 0;
04600 }
04601 
04602 
04603 void
04604 ConstExpr::Print() const {
04605     printf("[%s] (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
04606     for (int i = 0; i < Count(); ++i) {
04607         switch (getBasicType()) {
04608         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04609             printf("%s", boolVal[i] ? "true" : "false");
04610             break;
04611         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04612             printf("%d", (int)int8Val[i]);
04613             break;
04614         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04615             printf("%u", (int)uint8Val[i]);
04616             break;
04617         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04618             printf("%d", (int)int16Val[i]);
04619             break;
04620         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04621             printf("%u", (int)uint16Val[i]);
04622             break;
04623         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04624             printf("%d", int32Val[i]);
04625             break;
04626         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04627             printf("%u", uint32Val[i]);
04628             break;
04629         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04630             printf("%f", floatVal[i]);
04631             break;
04632         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04633 #ifdef ISPC_IS_LINUX
04634             printf("%ld", int64Val[i]);
04635 #else
04636             printf("%lld", int64Val[i]);
04637 #endif
04638             break;
04639         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04640 #ifdef ISPC_IS_LINUX
04641             printf("%lu", uint64Val[i]);
04642 #else
04643             printf("%llu", uint64Val[i]);
04644 #endif
04645             break;
04646         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04647             printf("%f", doubleVal[i]);
04648             break;
04649         default:
04650             FATAL("unimplemented const type");
04651         }
04652         if (i != Count() - 1)
04653             printf(", ");
04654     }
04655     printf(")");
04656     pos.Print();
04657 }
04658 
04659 
04660 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
04661 // TypeCastExpr
04662 
04663 TypeCastExpr::TypeCastExpr(const Type *t, Expr *e, bool pu, SourcePos p) 
04664   : Expr(p) {
04665     type = t;
04666     expr = e;
04667     preserveUniformity = pu;
04668 }
04669 
04670 
04671 /** Handle all the grungy details of type conversion between atomic types.
04672     Given an input value in exprVal of type fromType, convert it to the
04673     llvm::Value with type toType.
04674  */
04675 static llvm::Value *
04676 lTypeConvAtomic(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *exprVal, 
04677                 const AtomicType *toType, const AtomicType *fromType,
04678                 SourcePos pos) {
04679     llvm::Value *cast = NULL;
04680 
04681     switch (toType->basicType) {
04682     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
04683         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04684             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::FloatType : 
04685                                         LLVMTypes::FloatVectorType;
04686         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04687         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04688             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04689                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04690                 // If we have a bool vector of i32 elements, first truncate
04691                 // down to a single bit
04692                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04693             // And then do an unisgned int->float cast
04694             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
04695                                  exprVal, targetType, "bool2float");
04696             break;
04697         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04698         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04699         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04700         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04701             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int to float
04702                                  exprVal, targetType, "int2float");
04703             break;
04704         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04705         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04706         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04707         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04708             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04709                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from unsigned int to float is slow. "
04710                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04711             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to float
04712                                  exprVal, targetType, "uint2float");
04713             break;
04714         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04715             // No-op cast.
04716             cast = exprVal;
04717             break;
04718         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04719             cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, "double2float");
04720             break;
04721         default:
04722             FATAL("unimplemented");
04723         }
04724         break;
04725     }
04726     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
04727         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04728             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::DoubleType :
04729                                         LLVMTypes::DoubleVectorType;
04730         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04731         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04732             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04733                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04734                 // truncate i32 bool vector values to i1s
04735                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04736             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int to double
04737                                  exprVal, targetType, "bool2double");
04738             break;
04739         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04740         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04741         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04742         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04743             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::SIToFP, // signed int
04744                                  exprVal, targetType, "int2double");
04745             break;
04746         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04747         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04748         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04749         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04750             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::UIToFP, // unsigned int
04751                                  exprVal, targetType, "uint2double");
04752             break;
04753         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04754             cast = ctx->FPCastInst(exprVal, targetType, "float2double");
04755             break;
04756         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04757             cast = exprVal;
04758             break;
04759         default:
04760             FATAL("unimplemented");
04761         }
04762         break;
04763     }
04764     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
04765         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04766             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
04767                                         LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
04768         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04769         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04770             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04771                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04772                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04773             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2int");
04774             break;
04775         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04776         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04777             cast = exprVal;
04778             break;
04779         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04780         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04781         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04782         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04783         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04784         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04785             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_int8");
04786             break;
04787         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04788             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04789                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2int");
04790             break;
04791         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04792             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04793                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2int");
04794             break;
04795         default:
04796             FATAL("unimplemented");
04797         }
04798         break;
04799     }
04800     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
04801         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04802             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int8Type :
04803                                         LLVMTypes::Int8VectorType;
04804         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04805         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04806             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04807                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04808                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04809             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2uint");
04810             break;
04811         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04812         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04813             cast = exprVal;
04814             break;
04815         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04816         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04817         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04818         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04819         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04820         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04821             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_uint8");
04822             break;
04823         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04824             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04825                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
04826                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04827             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04828                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2uint");
04829             break;
04830         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04831             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04832                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
04833                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04834             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04835                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2uint");
04836             break;
04837         default:
04838             FATAL("unimplemented");
04839         }
04840         break;
04841     }
04842     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
04843         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04844             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
04845                                         LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
04846         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04847         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04848             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04849                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04850                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04851             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2int");
04852             break;
04853         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04854             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "int2int16");
04855             break;
04856         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04857             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint16");
04858             break;
04859         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04860         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04861             cast = exprVal;
04862             break;
04863         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04864             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04865                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2int");
04866             break;
04867         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04868         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04869         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04870         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04871             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_int16");
04872             break;
04873         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04874             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04875                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2int");
04876             break;
04877         default:
04878             FATAL("unimplemented");
04879         }
04880         break;
04881     }
04882     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
04883         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04884             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int16Type :
04885                                         LLVMTypes::Int16VectorType;
04886         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04887         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04888             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04889                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04890                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04891             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2uint16");
04892             break;
04893         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04894             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint16");
04895             break;
04896         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04897             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint16");
04898             break;            
04899         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04900         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04901             cast = exprVal;
04902             break;
04903         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04904             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04905                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
04906                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04907             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04908                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2uint");
04909             break;
04910         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04911         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04912         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04913         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04914             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_uint16");
04915             break;
04916         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04917             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04918                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
04919                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04920             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04921                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2uint");
04922             break;
04923         default:
04924             FATAL("unimplemented");
04925         }
04926         break;
04927     }
04928     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
04929         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04930             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
04931                                         LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
04932         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04933         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04934             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04935                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04936                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04937             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2int");
04938             break;
04939         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04940         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04941             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "int2int32");
04942             break;
04943         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04944         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04945             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint32");
04946             break;
04947         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04948         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04949             cast = exprVal;
04950             break;
04951         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04952             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04953                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2int");
04954             break;
04955         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04956         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
04957             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_int32");
04958             break;
04959         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
04960             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
04961                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2int");
04962             break;
04963         default:
04964             FATAL("unimplemented");
04965         }
04966         break;
04967     }
04968     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
04969         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
04970             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int32Type :
04971                                         LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType;
04972         switch (fromType->basicType) {
04973         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
04974             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
04975                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
04976                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
04977             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2uint");
04978             break;
04979         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
04980         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
04981             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint");
04982             break;
04983         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
04984         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
04985             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint2uint");
04986             break;            
04987         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
04988         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
04989             cast = exprVal;
04990             break;
04991         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
04992             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
04993                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int is slow. "
04994                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
04995             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
04996                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2uint");
04997             break;
04998         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
04999         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
05000             cast = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, targetType, "int64_to_uint32");
05001             break;
05002         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
05003             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
05004                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int is slow. "
05005                                    "Use \"int\" if possible");
05006             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // unsigned int
05007                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2uint");
05008             break;
05009         default:
05010             FATAL("unimplemented");
05011         }
05012         break;
05013     }
05014     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
05015         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
05016             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : 
05017                                         LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
05018         switch (fromType->basicType) {
05019         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
05020             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() &&
05021                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
05022                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
05023             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2int64");
05024             break;
05025         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
05026         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
05027         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
05028             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "int_to_int64");
05029             break;
05030         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
05031         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
05032         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
05033             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint_to_int64");
05034             break;
05035         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
05036             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
05037                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2int64");
05038             break;
05039         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
05040         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
05041             cast = exprVal;
05042             break;
05043         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
05044             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToSI, // signed int
05045                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2int64");
05046             break;
05047         default:
05048             FATAL("unimplemented");
05049         }
05050         break;
05051     }
05052     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
05053         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *targetType = 
05054             fromType->IsUniformType() ? LLVMTypes::Int64Type : 
05055                                         LLVMTypes::Int64VectorType;
05056         switch (fromType->basicType) {
05057         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
05058             if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && 
05059                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType)
05060                 exprVal = ctx->TruncInst(exprVal, LLVMTypes::Int1VectorType, "bool_to_i1");
05061             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "bool2uint");
05062             break;
05063         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
05064         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
05065         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
05066             cast = ctx->SExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "int_to_uint64");
05067             break;
05068         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
05069         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
05070         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
05071             cast = ctx->ZExtInst(exprVal, targetType, "uint_to_uint64");
05072             break;
05073         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
05074             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
05075                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from float to unsigned int64 is slow. "
05076                                    "Use \"int64\" if possible");
05077             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
05078                                  exprVal, targetType, "float2uint");
05079             break;
05080         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
05081         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
05082             cast = exprVal;
05083             break;
05084         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
05085             if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
05086                 PerformanceWarning(pos, "Conversion from double to unsigned int64 is slow. "
05087                                    "Use \"int64\" if possible");
05088             cast = ctx->CastInst(llvm::Instruction::FPToUI, // signed int
05089                                  exprVal, targetType, "double2uint");
05090             break;
05091         default:
05092             FATAL("unimplemented");
05093         }
05094         break;
05095     }
05096     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
05097         switch (fromType->basicType) {
05098         case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
05099             cast = exprVal;
05100             break;
05101         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
05102         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
05103             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8(0) : 
05104                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt8Vector((int8_t)0);
05105             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
05106                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpi0");
05107             break;
05108         }
05109         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
05110         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
05111             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16(0) : 
05112                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt16Vector((int16_t)0);
05113             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
05114                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpi0");
05115             break;
05116         }
05117         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
05118         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
05119             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32(0) : 
05120                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt32Vector(0);
05121             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
05122                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpi0");
05123             break;
05124         }
05125         case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
05126             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloat(0.f) : 
05127                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMFloatVector(0.f);
05128             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
05129                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpf0");
05130             break;
05131         }
05132         case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
05133         case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
05134             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64(0) : 
05135                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMInt64Vector((int64_t)0);
05136             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
05137                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpi0");
05138             break;
05139         }
05140         case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
05141             llvm::Value *zero = fromType->IsUniformType() ? (llvm::Value *)LLVMDouble(0.) : 
05142                 (llvm::Value *)LLVMDoubleVector(0.);
05143             cast = ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::FCmp, llvm::CmpInst::FCMP_ONE,
05144                                 exprVal, zero, "cmpd0");
05145             break;
05146         }
05147         default:
05148             FATAL("unimplemented");
05149         }
05150 
05151         if (fromType->IsUniformType()) {
05152             if (toType->IsVaryingType() && 
05153                 LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType == LLVMTypes::Int32VectorType) {
05154                 // extend out to i32 bool values from i1 here.  then we'll
05155                 // turn into a vector below, the way it does for everyone
05156                 // else...
05157                 cast = ctx->SExtInst(cast, LLVMTypes::BoolVectorType->getElementType(),
05158                                      "i1bool_to_i32bool");
05159             }
05160         }
05161         else
05162             // fromType->IsVaryingType())
05163             cast = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cast);
05164 
05165         break;
05166     }
05167     default:
05168         FATAL("unimplemented");
05169     }
05170 
05171     // If we also want to go from uniform to varying, replicate out the
05172     // value across the vector elements..
05173     if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
05174         return ctx->SmearUniform(cast);
05175     else
05176         return cast;
05177 }
05178 
05179 
05180 // FIXME: fold this into the FunctionEmitContext::SmearUniform() method?
05181 
05182 /** Converts the given value of the given type to be the varying
05183     equivalent, returning the resulting value.
05184  */
05185 static llvm::Value *
05186 lUniformValueToVarying(FunctionEmitContext *ctx, llvm::Value *value,
05187                        const Type *type) {
05188     // nothing to do if it's already varying
05189     if (type->IsVaryingType())
05190         return value;
05191 
05192     // for structs/arrays/vectors, just recursively make their elements
05193     // varying (if needed) and populate the return value.
05194     const CollectionType *collectionType = 
05195         dynamic_cast<const CollectionType *>(type);
05196     if (collectionType != NULL) {
05197         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmType = 
05198             type->GetAsVaryingType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
05199         llvm::Value *retValue = llvm::UndefValue::get(llvmType);
05200 
05201         for (int i = 0; i < collectionType->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
05202             llvm::Value *v = ctx->ExtractInst(value, i, "get_element");
05203             v = lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, v, collectionType->GetElementType(i));
05204             retValue = ctx->InsertInst(retValue, v, i, "set_element");
05205         }
05206         return retValue;
05207     }
05208 
05209     // Otherwise we must have a uniform AtomicType, so smear its value
05210     // across the vector lanes.
05211     Assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(type) != NULL);
05212     return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
05213 }
05214 
05215 
05216 llvm::Value *
05217 TypeCastExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05218     if (!expr)
05219         return NULL;
05220 
05221     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
05222     const Type *toType = GetType(), *fromType = expr->GetType();
05223     if (!toType || !fromType || toType == AtomicType::Void || 
05224         fromType == AtomicType::Void)
05225         // an error should have been issued elsewhere in this case
05226         return NULL;
05227 
05228     const PointerType *fromPointerType = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(fromType);
05229     const PointerType *toPointerType = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(toType);
05230     const ArrayType *toArrayType = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(toType);
05231     const ArrayType *fromArrayType = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(fromType);
05232     if (fromPointerType != NULL) {
05233         if (toArrayType != NULL) {
05234             return expr->GetValue(ctx);
05235         }
05236         else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
05237             llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05238             if (value == NULL)
05239                 return NULL;
05240 
05241             if (fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsUniformType())
05242                 // bitcast to the actual pointer type
05243                 return ctx->BitCastInst(value, toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
05244             else if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsVaryingType()) {
05245                 // both are vectors of ints already, nothing to do at the IR
05246                 // level
05247                 return value;
05248             }
05249             else {
05250                 Assert(fromType->IsUniformType() && toType->IsVaryingType());
05251                 value = ctx->PtrToIntInst(value);
05252                 return ctx->SmearUniform(value);
05253             }
05254         }
05255         else {
05256             Assert(dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType) != NULL);
05257             if (toType->IsBoolType()) {
05258                 // convert pointer to bool
05259                 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *lfu = 
05260                     fromType->GetAsUniformType()->LLVMType(g->ctx);
05261                 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType *llvmFromUnifType = 
05262                     llvm::dyn_cast<LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::PointerType>(lfu);
05263 
05264                 llvm::Value *nullPtrValue = 
05265                     llvm::ConstantPointerNull::get(llvmFromUnifType);
05266                 if (fromType->IsVaryingType())
05267                     nullPtrValue = ctx->SmearUniform(nullPtrValue);
05268 
05269                 llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05270                 llvm::Value *cmp = 
05271                     ctx->CmpInst(llvm::Instruction::ICmp, llvm::CmpInst::ICMP_NE,
05272                                  exprVal, nullPtrValue, "ptr_ne_NULL");
05273 
05274                 if (toType->IsVaryingType()) {
05275                     if (fromType->IsUniformType())
05276                         cmp = ctx->SmearUniform(cmp);
05277                     cmp = ctx->I1VecToBoolVec(cmp);
05278                 }
05279 
05280                 return cmp;
05281             }
05282             else {
05283                 // ptr -> int
05284                 llvm::Value *value = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05285                 if (value == NULL)
05286                     return NULL;
05287 
05288                 if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
05289                     value = ctx->SmearUniform(value);
05290 
05291                 LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
05292                 if (llvmToType == NULL)
05293                     return NULL;
05294                 return ctx->PtrToIntInst(value, llvmToType, "ptr_typecast");
05295             }
05296         }
05297     }
05298 
05299     if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toType, fromType))
05300         // There's nothing to do, just return the value.  (LLVM's type
05301         // system doesn't worry about constiness.)
05302         return expr->GetValue(ctx);
05303 
05304     if (fromArrayType != NULL && toPointerType != NULL) {
05305         // implicit array to pointer to first element
05306         Expr *arrayAsPtr = lArrayToPointer(expr);
05307         if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType) == false) {
05308             Assert(Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType()->GetAsVaryingType(),
05309                                             toPointerType) == true);
05310             arrayAsPtr = new TypeCastExpr(toPointerType, arrayAsPtr, false, pos);
05311             arrayAsPtr = arrayAsPtr->TypeCheck();
05312             Assert(arrayAsPtr != NULL);
05313             arrayAsPtr = arrayAsPtr->Optimize();
05314             Assert(arrayAsPtr != NULL);
05315         }
05316         Assert(Type::EqualIgnoringConst(arrayAsPtr->GetType(), toPointerType));
05317         return arrayAsPtr->GetValue(ctx);
05318     }
05319 
05320     // This also should be caught during typechecking
05321     Assert(!(toType->IsUniformType() && fromType->IsVaryingType()));
05322 
05323     if (toArrayType != NULL && fromArrayType != NULL) {
05324         // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
05325         // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
05326         if (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != 0 && 
05327             (toArrayType->GetElementCount() != fromArrayType->GetElementCount()))
05328             Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d",
05329                     fromArrayType->GetElementCount(), toArrayType->GetElementCount());
05330         Assert(Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArrayType->GetBaseType(),
05331                                         fromArrayType->GetBaseType()));
05332         llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05333         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
05334         return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
05335     }
05336 
05337     const ReferenceType *toReference = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(toType);
05338     const ReferenceType *fromReference = dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(fromType);
05339     if (toReference && fromReference) {
05340         const Type *toTarget = toReference->GetReferenceTarget();
05341         const Type *fromTarget = fromReference->GetReferenceTarget();
05342 
05343         const ArrayType *toArray = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(toTarget);
05344         const ArrayType *fromArray = dynamic_cast<const ArrayType *>(fromTarget);
05345         if (toArray && fromArray) {
05346             // cast array pointer from [n x foo] to [0 x foo] if needed to be able
05347             // to pass to a function that takes an unsized array as a parameter
05348             if(toArray->GetElementCount() != 0 && 
05349                (toArray->GetElementCount() != fromArray->GetElementCount()))
05350                 Warning(pos, "Type-converting array of length %d to length %d",
05351                         fromArray->GetElementCount(), toArray->GetElementCount());
05352             Assert(Type::EqualIgnoringConst(toArray->GetBaseType(),
05353                                             fromArray->GetBaseType()));
05354             llvm::Value *v = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05355             LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *ptype = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
05356             return ctx->BitCastInst(v, ptype); //, "array_cast_0size");
05357         }
05358 
05359         Assert(Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget) ||
05360                Type::Equal(toTarget, fromTarget->GetAsConstType()));
05361         return expr->GetValue(ctx);
05362     }
05363 
05364     const StructType *toStruct = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(toType);
05365     const StructType *fromStruct = dynamic_cast<const StructType *>(fromType);
05366     if (toStruct && fromStruct) {
05367         // The only legal type conversions for structs are to go from a
05368         // uniform to a varying instance of the same struct type.
05369         Assert(toStruct->IsVaryingType() && fromStruct->IsUniformType() &&
05370                Type::Equal(toStruct, fromStruct->GetAsVaryingType()));
05371 
05372         llvm::Value *origValue = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05373         if (!origValue)
05374             return NULL;
05375         return lUniformValueToVarying(ctx, origValue, fromType);
05376     }
05377 
05378     const VectorType *toVector = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(toType);
05379     const VectorType *fromVector = dynamic_cast<const VectorType *>(fromType);
05380     if (toVector && fromVector) {
05381         // this should be caught during typechecking
05382         Assert(toVector->GetElementCount() == fromVector->GetElementCount());
05383 
05384         llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05385         if (!exprVal)
05386             return NULL;
05387 
05388         // Emit instructions to do type conversion of each of the elements
05389         // of the vector.
05390         // FIXME: since uniform vectors are represented as
05391         // llvm::VectorTypes, we should just be able to issue the
05392         // corresponding vector type convert, which should be more
05393         // efficient by avoiding serialization!
05394         llvm::Value *cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
05395         for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i) {
05396             llvm::Value *ei = ctx->ExtractInst(exprVal, i);
05397 
05398             llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, ei, toVector->GetElementType(),
05399                                                 fromVector->GetElementType(), pos);
05400             if (!conv) 
05401                 return NULL;
05402             cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
05403         }
05404         return cast;
05405     }
05406 
05407     llvm::Value *exprVal = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05408     if (!exprVal)
05409         return NULL;
05410 
05411     const EnumType *fromEnum = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(fromType);
05412     const EnumType *toEnum = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(toType);
05413     if (fromEnum)
05414         // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
05415         fromType = fromEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
05416             AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
05417     if (toEnum)
05418         // treat it as an uint32 type for the below and all will be good.
05419         toType = toEnum->IsUniformType() ? AtomicType::UniformUInt32 :
05420             AtomicType::VaryingUInt32;
05421 
05422     const AtomicType *fromAtomic = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(fromType);
05423     // at this point, coming from an atomic type is all that's left...
05424     Assert(fromAtomic != NULL);
05425 
05426     if (toVector) {
05427         // scalar -> short vector conversion
05428         llvm::Value *conv = lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toVector->GetElementType(),
05429                                             fromAtomic, pos);
05430         if (!conv) 
05431             return NULL;
05432 
05433         llvm::Value *cast = llvm::UndefValue::get(toType->LLVMType(g->ctx));
05434         for (int i = 0; i < toVector->GetElementCount(); ++i)
05435             cast = ctx->InsertInst(cast, conv, i);
05436         return cast;
05437     }
05438     else if (toPointerType != NULL) {
05439         // int -> ptr
05440         if (toType->IsVaryingType() && fromType->IsUniformType())
05441             exprVal = ctx->SmearUniform(exprVal);
05442 
05443         LLVM_TYPE_CONST llvm::Type *llvmToType = toType->LLVMType(g->ctx);
05444         if (llvmToType == NULL)
05445             return NULL;
05446 
05447         return ctx->IntToPtrInst(exprVal, llvmToType, "int_to_ptr");
05448     }
05449     else {
05450         const AtomicType *toAtomic = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType);
05451         // typechecking should ensure this is the case
05452         Assert(toAtomic != NULL);
05453 
05454         return lTypeConvAtomic(ctx, exprVal, toAtomic, fromAtomic, pos);
05455     }
05456 }
05457 
05458 
05459 const Type *
05460 TypeCastExpr::GetType() const { 
05461     return type; 
05462 }
05463 
05464 
05465 static const Type *
05466 lDeconstifyType(const Type *t) {
05467     const PointerType *pt = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(t);
05468     if (pt != NULL)
05469         return new PointerType(lDeconstifyType(pt->GetBaseType()), 
05470                                pt->IsUniformType(), false);
05471     else
05472         return t->GetAsNonConstType();
05473 }
05474 
05475 
05476 Expr *
05477 TypeCastExpr::TypeCheck() {
05478     if (expr != NULL) 
05479         expr = expr->TypeCheck();
05480     if (expr == NULL)
05481         return NULL;
05482 
05483     const Type *toType = GetType(), *fromType = expr->GetType();
05484     if (toType == NULL || fromType == NULL)
05485         return NULL;
05486 
05487     if (preserveUniformity == true && fromType->IsUniformType() &&
05488         toType->IsVaryingType()) {
05489         TypeCastExpr *tce = new TypeCastExpr(toType->GetAsUniformType(),
05490                                              expr, false, pos);
05491         return tce->TypeCheck();
05492     }
05493 
05494     fromType = lDeconstifyType(fromType);
05495     toType = lDeconstifyType(toType);
05496 
05497     if (fromType->IsVaryingType() && toType->IsUniformType()) {
05498         Error(pos, "Can't type cast from varying type \"%s\" to uniform "
05499               "type \"%s\"", fromType->GetString().c_str(),
05500               toType->GetString().c_str());
05501         return NULL;
05502     }
05503 
05504     // First some special cases that we allow only with an explicit type cast
05505     const PointerType *fromPtr = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(fromType);
05506     const PointerType *toPtr = dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(toType);
05507     if (fromPtr != NULL && toPtr != NULL)
05508         // allow explicit typecasts between any two different pointer types
05509         return this;
05510 
05511     const AtomicType *fromAtomic = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(fromType);
05512     const AtomicType *toAtomic = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType);
05513     const EnumType *fromEnum = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(fromType);
05514     const EnumType *toEnum = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(toType);
05515     if ((fromAtomic || fromEnum) && (toAtomic || toEnum))
05516         // Allow explicit casts between all of these
05517         return this;
05518 
05519     // ptr -> int type casts
05520     if (fromPtr != NULL && toAtomic != NULL && toAtomic->IsIntType()) {
05521         bool safeCast = (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
05522                          toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64);
05523         if (g->target.is32Bit)
05524             safeCast |= (toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 ||
05525                          toAtomic->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32);
05526         if (safeCast == false)
05527             Warning(pos, "Pointer type cast of type \"%s\" to integer type "
05528                     "\"%s\" may lose information.", 
05529                     fromType->GetString().c_str(), 
05530                     toType->GetString().c_str());
05531         return this;
05532     }
05533 
05534     // int -> ptr
05535     if (fromAtomic != NULL && fromAtomic->IsIntType() && toPtr != NULL)
05536         return this;
05537 
05538     // And otherwise see if it's one of the conversions allowed to happen
05539     // implicitly.
05540     if (CanConvertTypes(fromType, toType, "type cast expression", pos) == false)
05541         return NULL;
05542 
05543     return this;
05544 }
05545 
05546 
05547 Expr *
05548 TypeCastExpr::Optimize() {
05549     if (expr != NULL) 
05550         expr = expr->Optimize();
05551     if (expr == NULL)
05552         return NULL;
05553 
05554     ConstExpr *constExpr = dynamic_cast<ConstExpr *>(expr);
05555     if (!constExpr)
05556         // We can't do anything if this isn't a const expr
05557         return this;
05558 
05559     const Type *toType = GetType();
05560     const AtomicType *toAtomic = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(toType);
05561     const EnumType *toEnum = dynamic_cast<const EnumType *>(toType);
05562     // If we're not casting to an atomic or enum type, we can't do anything
05563     // here, since ConstExprs can only represent those two types.  (So
05564     // e.g. we're casting from an int to an int<4>.)
05565     if (toAtomic == NULL && toEnum == NULL)
05566         return this;
05567 
05568     bool forceVarying = toType->IsVaryingType();
05569 
05570     // All of the type conversion smarts we need is already in the
05571     // ConstExpr::AsBool(), etc., methods, so we just need to call the
05572     // appropriate one for the type that this cast is converting to.
05573     AtomicType::BasicType basicType = toAtomic ? toAtomic->basicType :
05574         AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32;
05575     switch (basicType) {
05576     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL: {
05577         bool bv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05578         constExpr->AsBool(bv, forceVarying);
05579         return new ConstExpr(toType, bv, pos);
05580     }
05581     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8: {
05582         int8_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05583         constExpr->AsInt8(iv, forceVarying);
05584         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
05585     }
05586     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8: {
05587         uint8_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05588         constExpr->AsUInt8(uv, forceVarying);
05589         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
05590     }
05591     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16: {
05592         int16_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05593         constExpr->AsInt16(iv, forceVarying);
05594         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
05595     }
05596     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16: {
05597         uint16_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05598         constExpr->AsUInt16(uv, forceVarying);
05599         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
05600     }
05601     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32: {
05602         int32_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05603         constExpr->AsInt32(iv, forceVarying);
05604         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
05605     }
05606     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32: {
05607         uint32_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05608         constExpr->AsUInt32(uv, forceVarying);
05609         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
05610     }
05611     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT: {
05612         float fv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05613         constExpr->AsFloat(fv, forceVarying);
05614         return new ConstExpr(toType, fv, pos);
05615     }
05616     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64: {
05617         int64_t iv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05618         constExpr->AsInt64(iv, forceVarying);
05619         return new ConstExpr(toType, iv, pos);
05620     }
05621     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64: {
05622         uint64_t uv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05623         constExpr->AsUInt64(uv, forceVarying);
05624         return new ConstExpr(toType, uv, pos);
05625     }
05626     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE: {
05627         double dv[ISPC_MAX_NVEC];
05628         constExpr->AsDouble(dv, forceVarying);
05629         return new ConstExpr(toType, dv, pos);
05630     }
05631     default:
05632         FATAL("unimplemented");
05633     }
05634     return this;
05635 }
05636 
05637 
05638 int
05639 TypeCastExpr::EstimateCost() const {
05640     // FIXME: return COST_TYPECAST_COMPLEX when appropriate
05641     return COST_TYPECAST_SIMPLE;
05642 }

05645 void
05646 TypeCastExpr::Print() const {
05647     printf("[%s] type cast (", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
05648     expr->Print();
05649     printf(")");
05650     pos.Print();
05651 }

05653 
05654 Symbol *
05655 TypeCastExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
05656     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
05657 }
05658 
05659 
05660 llvm::Constant *
05661 TypeCastExpr::GetConstant(const Type *constType) const {
05662     // We don't need to worry about most the basic cases where the type
05663     // cast can resolve to a constant here, since the
05664     // TypeCastExpr::Optimize() method ends up doing the type conversion
05665     // and returning a ConstExpr, which in turn will have its GetConstant()
05666     // method called.  Thus, the only case we do need to worry about here
05667     // is converting a uniform function pointer to a varying function
05668     // pointer of the same type.
05669     Assert(Type::Equal(constType, type));
05670     const FunctionType *ft = NULL;
05671     if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(type) == NULL ||
05672         (ft = dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(type->GetBaseType())) == NULL)
05673         return NULL;
05674 
05675     llvm::Constant *ec = expr->GetConstant(expr->GetType());
05676     if (ec == NULL)
05677         return NULL;
05678 
05679     ec = llvm::ConstantExpr::getPtrToInt(ec, LLVMTypes::PointerIntType);
05680 
05681     Assert(type->IsVaryingType());
05682     std::vector<llvm::Constant *> smear;
05683     for (int i = 0; i < g->target.vectorWidth; ++i)
05684         smear.push_back(ec);
05685     return llvm::ConstantVector::get(smear);
05686 }

05780     : Expr(p) {
05781     expr = e;
05782 }
05783 
05784 
05785 llvm::Value *
05786 DereferenceExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05787     if (expr == NULL) 
05788         return NULL;
05789     llvm::Value *ptr = expr->GetValue(ctx);
05790     if (ptr == NULL)
05791         return NULL;
05792     const Type *type = expr->GetType();
05793     if (type == NULL)
05794         return NULL;
05795 
05796     Symbol *baseSym = expr->GetBaseSymbol();
05797     llvm::Value *mask = baseSym ? lMaskForSymbol(baseSym, ctx) : 
05798         ctx->GetFullMask();
05799 
05800     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
05801     return ctx->LoadInst(ptr, mask, type, "deref_load");
05802 }
05803 
05804 
05805 llvm::Value *
05806 DereferenceExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
05807     if (expr == NULL) 
05808         return NULL;
05809     return expr->GetValue(ctx);
05810 }
05811 
05812 
05813 const Type *
05814 DereferenceExpr::GetLValueType() const {
05815     if (expr == NULL)
05816         return NULL;
05817     return expr->GetType();
05818 }
05819 
05820 
05821 Symbol *
05822 DereferenceExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
05823     return expr ? expr->GetBaseSymbol() : NULL;
05824 }
05825 
05826 
05827 const Type *
05828 DereferenceExpr::GetType() const {
05829     if (expr == NULL)
05830         return NULL;
05831     const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
05832     if (exprType == NULL)
05833         return NULL;
05834     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(exprType) != NULL)
05835         return exprType->GetReferenceTarget();
05836     else {
05837         Assert(dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(exprType) != NULL);
05838         if (exprType->IsUniformType())
05839             return exprType->GetBaseType();
05840         else
05841             return exprType->GetBaseType()->GetAsVaryingType();
05842     }
05843 }
05844 
05845 
05846 Expr *
05847 DereferenceExpr::TypeCheck() {
05848     if (expr != NULL)
05849         expr = expr->TypeCheck();
05850     if (expr == NULL)
05851         return NULL;
05852     return this;
05853 }
05854 
05855 
05856 Expr *
05857 DereferenceExpr::Optimize() {
05858     if (expr != NULL) 
05859         expr = expr->Optimize();
05860     if (expr == NULL)
05861         return NULL;
05862     return this;
05863 }
05864 
05865 
05866 int
05867 DereferenceExpr::EstimateCost() const {
05868     if (expr == NULL)
05869         return 0;
05870 
05871     const Type *exprType = expr->GetType();
05872     if (dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(exprType) &&
05873         exprType->IsVaryingType())
05874         // Be pessimistic; some of these will later be optimized into
05875         // vector loads/stores..
05876         return COST_GATHER + COST_DEREF;
05877     else
05878         return COST_DEREF;
05879 }
05880

05883 DereferenceExpr::Print() const {
05884     if (expr == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
05885         return;
05886 
05887     printf("[%s] *(", GetType()->GetString().c_str());
05888     expr->Print();
05889     printf(")");
05890     pos.Print();
05891 }

05924     else

06046 
06047 llvm::Value *
06048 SymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
06049     // storagePtr may be NULL due to an earlier compilation error
06050     if (!symbol || !symbol->storagePtr)
06051         return NULL;
06052     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
06053     return ctx->LoadInst(symbol->storagePtr, symbol->name.c_str());
06054 }
06055 
06056 
06057 llvm::Value *
06058 SymbolExpr::GetLValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
06059     if (symbol == NULL)
06060         return NULL;
06061     ctx->SetDebugPos(pos);
06062     return symbol->storagePtr;
06063 }
06064 
06065 
06066 const Type *
06067 SymbolExpr::GetLValueType() const {
06068     if (symbol == NULL)
06069         return NULL;
06070 
06071     return PointerType::GetUniform(symbol->type);
06072 }

06075 Symbol *
06076 SymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
06077     return symbol;
06078 }

06082 SymbolExpr::GetType() const { 
06083     return symbol ? symbol->type : NULL;
06084 }
06085 
06086 
06087 Expr *
06088 SymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
06089     return this;
06090 }
06091 
06092 
06093 Expr *
06094 SymbolExpr::Optimize() {
06095     if (symbol == NULL)
06096         return NULL;
06097     else if (symbol->constValue != NULL) {
06098         Assert(GetType()->IsConstType());
06099         return symbol->constValue;
06100     }
06101     else
06102         return this;
06103 }

06106 int
06107 SymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
06108     // Be optimistic and assume it's in a register or can be used as a
06109     // memory operand..
06110     return 0;
06111 }

06116     if (symbol == NULL || GetType() == NULL)
06117         return;

06120            symbol->name.c_str());
06121     pos.Print();
06122 }

06125 ///////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
06126 // FunctionSymbolExpr
06127 
06128 FunctionSymbolExpr::FunctionSymbolExpr(const char *n,
06129                                        const std::vector<Symbol *> &candidates,
06130                                        SourcePos p) 
06131   : Expr(p) {
06132     name = n;
06133     candidateFunctions = candidates;
06134     matchingFunc = (candidates.size() == 1) ? candidates[0] : NULL;
06135     triedToResolve = false;
06136 }
06137 
06138 
06139 const Type *
06140 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetType() const {
06141     if (triedToResolve == false && matchingFunc == NULL) {
06142         Error(pos, "Ambiguous use of overloaded function \"%s\".", 
06143               name.c_str());
06144         return NULL;
06145     }
06146 
06147     return matchingFunc ? new PointerType(matchingFunc->type, true, true) : NULL;
06148 }
06149

06151 llvm::Value *
06152 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetValue(FunctionEmitContext *ctx) const {
06153     return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->function : NULL;
06154 }
06155 
06156 
06157 Symbol *
06158 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetBaseSymbol() const {
06159     return matchingFunc;
06160 }
06161 
06162 
06163 Expr *
06164 FunctionSymbolExpr::TypeCheck() {
06165     return this;
06166 }
06167 
06168 
06169 Expr *
06170 FunctionSymbolExpr::Optimize() {
06171     return this;
06172 }

06175 int
06176 FunctionSymbolExpr::EstimateCost() const {
06177     return 0;
06178 }

06181 void
06182 FunctionSymbolExpr::Print() const {
06183     if (!matchingFunc || !GetType())
06184         return;
06185 
06186     printf("[%s] fun sym (%s)", GetType()->GetString().c_str(),
06187            matchingFunc->name.c_str());
06188     pos.Print();
06189 }

06192 llvm::Constant *
06193 FunctionSymbolExpr::GetConstant(const Type *type) const {
06194     Assert(type->IsUniformType());
06195     Assert(GetType()->IsUniformType());
06196 
06197     if (Type::EqualIgnoringConst(type, GetType()) == false)
06198         return NULL;
06199 
06200     return matchingFunc ? matchingFunc->function : NULL;
06201 }

06204 static void
06205 lPrintOverloadCandidates(SourcePos pos, const std::vector<Symbol *> &funcs, 
06206                          const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes, 
06207                          const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL) {
06208     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < funcs.size(); ++i)
06209         Error(funcs[i]->pos, "Candidate function:");
06210 
06211     std::string passedTypes = "Passed types: (";
06212     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < argTypes.size(); ++i) {
06213         if (argTypes[i] != NULL)
06214             passedTypes += argTypes[i]->GetString();
06215         else
06216             passedTypes += "(unknown type)";
06217         passedTypes += (i < argTypes.size()-1) ? ", " : ")\n\n";
06218     }
06219     Error(pos, "%s", passedTypes.c_str());
06220 }
