06222              
06223 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns zero
06224     cost if the call argument's type exactly matches the function argument
06225     type (modulo a conversion to a const type if needed), otherwise reports
06226     failure.
06227  */ 
06228 static int
06229 lExactMatch(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
06230     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(callType) == NULL)
06231         callType = callType->GetAsNonConstType();
06232     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(funcArgType) != NULL && 
06233         dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(callType) == NULL)
06234         callType = new ReferenceType(callType);
06235 
06236     return Type::Equal(callType, funcArgType) ? 0 : -1;
06237 }
06238 
06239 
06240 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
06241     of 1 if the call argument type and the function argument type match,
06242     modulo conversion to a reference type if needed.
06243  */
06244 static int
06245 lMatchIgnoringReferences(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
06246     int prev = lExactMatch(callType, funcArgType);
06247     if (prev != -1)
06248         return prev;
06249 
06250     callType = callType->GetReferenceTarget();
06251     if (funcArgType->IsConstType())
06252         callType = callType->GetAsConstType();
06253 
06254     return Type::Equal(callType,
06255                        funcArgType->GetReferenceTarget()) ? 1 : -1;
06256 }
06257 
06258 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
06259     of 1 if converting the argument to the call type only requires a type
06260     conversion that won't lose information.  Otherwise reports failure.
06261 */
06262 static int
06263 lMatchWithTypeWidening(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
06264     int prev = lMatchIgnoringReferences(callType, funcArgType);
06265     if (prev != -1)
06266         return prev;
06267 
06268     const AtomicType *callAt = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(callType);
06269     const AtomicType *funcAt = dynamic_cast<const AtomicType *>(funcArgType);
06270     if (callAt == NULL || funcAt == NULL)
06271         return -1;
06272 
06273     if (callAt->IsUniformType() != funcAt->IsUniformType())
06274         return -1;
06275 
06276     switch (callAt->basicType) {
06277     case AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL:
06278         return 1;
06279     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT8:
06280     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8:
06281         return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL) ? 1 : -1;
06282     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT16:
06283     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT16:
06284         return (funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_BOOL &&
06285                 funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_INT8 &&
06286                 funcAt->basicType != AtomicType::TYPE_UINT8) ? 1 : -1;
06287     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT32:
06288     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32:
06289         return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT32 ||
06290                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT32 ||
06291                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
06292                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64) ? 1 : -1;
06293     case AtomicType::TYPE_FLOAT:
06294         return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE) ? 1 : -1;
06295     case AtomicType::TYPE_INT64:
06296     case AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64:
06297         return (funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_INT64 ||
06298                 funcAt->basicType == AtomicType::TYPE_UINT64) ? 1 : -1;
06299     case AtomicType::TYPE_DOUBLE:
06300         return -1;
06301     default:
06302         FATAL("Unhandled atomic type");
06303         return -1;
06304     }
06305 }
06306 
06307 
06308 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
06309     of 1 if the call argument type and the function argument type match if
06310     we only do a uniform -> varying type conversion but otherwise have
06311     exactly the same type.
06312  */
06313 static int
06314 lMatchIgnoringUniform(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
06315     int prev = lMatchWithTypeWidening(callType, funcArgType);
06316     if (prev != -1)
06317         return prev;
06318 
06319     if (dynamic_cast<const ReferenceType *>(callType) == NULL)
06320         callType = callType->GetAsNonConstType();
06321 
06322     return (callType->IsUniformType() && 
06323             funcArgType->IsVaryingType() &&
06324             Type::Equal(callType->GetAsVaryingType(), funcArgType)) ? 1 : -1;
06325 }
06326 
06327 
06328 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
06329     of 1 if we can type convert from the call argument type to the function
06330     argument type, but without doing a uniform -> varying conversion.
06331  */
06332 static int
06333 lMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(const Type *callType,
06334                                   const Type *funcArgType) {
06335     int prev = lMatchIgnoringUniform(callType, funcArgType);
06336     if (prev != -1)
06337         return prev;
06338 
06339     if (CanConvertTypes(callType, funcArgType) &&
06340         (callType->IsUniformType() == funcArgType->IsUniformType()))
06341         return 1;
06342     else
06343         return -1;
06344 }
06345 
06346 
06347 /** Helper function used for function overload resolution: returns a cost
06348     of 1 if there is any type conversion that gets us from the caller
06349     argument type to the function argument type.
06350  */
06351 static int
06352 lMatchWithTypeConv(const Type *callType, const Type *funcArgType) {
06353     int prev = lMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability(callType, funcArgType);
06354     if (prev != -1)
06355         return prev;
06356         
06357     return CanConvertTypes(callType, funcArgType) ? 0 : -1;
06358 }
06359 
06360 
06361 /** Given a set of potential matching functions and their associated cost,
06362     return the one with the lowest cost, if unique.  Otherwise, if multiple
06363     functions match with the same cost, return NULL.
06364  */
06365 static Symbol *
06366 lGetBestMatch(std::vector<std::pair<int, Symbol *> > &matches) {
06367     Assert(matches.size() > 0);
06368     int minCost = matches[0].first;
06369 
06370     for (unsigned int i = 1; i < matches.size(); ++i)
06371         minCost = std::min(minCost, matches[i].first);
06372 
06373     Symbol *match = NULL;
06374     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < matches.size(); ++i) {
06375         if (matches[i].first == minCost) {
06376             if (match != NULL)
06377                 // multiple things had the same cost
06378                 return NULL;
06379             else
06380                 match = matches[i].second;
06381         }
06382     }
06383     return match;
06384 }
06385 
06386 
06387 /** See if we can find a single function from the set of overload options
06388     based on the predicate function passed in.  Returns true if no more
06389     tries should be made to find a match, either due to success from
06390     finding a single overloaded function that matches or failure due to
06391     finding multiple ambiguous matches.
06392  */
06393 bool
06394 FunctionSymbolExpr::tryResolve(int (*matchFunc)(const Type *, const Type *),
06395                                SourcePos argPos,
06396                                const std::vector<const Type *> &callTypes,
06397                                const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL) {
06398     const char *funName = candidateFunctions.front()->name.c_str();
06399 
06400     std::vector<std::pair<int, Symbol *> > matches;
06401     std::vector<Symbol *>::iterator iter;
06402     for (iter = candidateFunctions.begin(); 
06403          iter != candidateFunctions.end(); ++iter) {
06404         // Loop over the set of candidate functions and try each one
06405         Symbol *candidateFunction = *iter;
06406         const FunctionType *ft = 
06407             dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(candidateFunction->type);
06408         Assert(ft != NULL);
06409 
06410         // There's no way to match if the caller is passing more arguments
06411         // than this function instance takes.
06412         if ((int)callTypes.size() > ft->GetNumParameters())
06413             continue;
06414 
06415         int i;
06416         // Note that we're looping over the caller arguments, not the
06417         // function arguments; it may be ok to have more arguments to the
06418         // function than are passed, if the function has default argument
06419         // values.  This case is handled below.
06420         int cost = 0;
06421         for (i = 0; i < (int)callTypes.size(); ++i) {
06422             // This may happen if there's an error earlier in compilation.
06423             // It's kind of a silly to redundantly discover this for each
06424             // potential match versus detecting this earlier in the
06425             // matching process and just giving up.
06426             const Type *paramType = ft->GetParameterType(i);
06427 
06428             if (callTypes[i] == NULL || paramType == NULL ||
06429                 dynamic_cast<const FunctionType *>(callTypes[i]) != NULL)
06430                 return false;
06431 
06432             int argCost = matchFunc(callTypes[i], paramType);
06433             if (argCost == -1) {
06434                 if (argCouldBeNULL != NULL && (*argCouldBeNULL)[i] == true &&
06435                     dynamic_cast<const PointerType *>(paramType) != NULL)
06436                     // If the passed argument value is zero and this is a
06437                     // pointer type, then it can convert to a NULL value of
06438                     // that pointer type.
06439                     argCost = 0;
06440                 else
06441                     // If the predicate function returns -1, we have failed no
06442                     // matter what else happens, so we stop trying
06443                     break;
06444             }
06445             cost += argCost;
06446         }
06447         if (i == (int)callTypes.size()) {
06448             // All of the arguments matched!
06449             if (i == ft->GetNumParameters())
06450                 // And we have exactly as many arguments as the function
06451                 // wants, so we're done.
06452                 matches.push_back(std::make_pair(cost, candidateFunction));
06453             else if (i < ft->GetNumParameters() && 
06454                      ft->GetParameterDefault(i) != NULL)
06455                 // Otherwise we can still make it if there are default
06456                 // arguments for the rest of the arguments!  Because in
06457                 // Module::AddFunction() we have verified that once the
06458                 // default arguments start, then all of the following ones
06459                 // have them as well.  Therefore, we just need to check if
06460                 // the arg we stopped at has a default value and we're
06461                 // done.
06462                 matches.push_back(std::make_pair(cost, candidateFunction));
06463             // otherwise, we don't have a match
06464         }
06465     }
06466 
06467     if (matches.size() == 0)
06468         return false;
06469     else if ((matchingFunc = lGetBestMatch(matches)) != NULL)
06470         // We have a match!
06471         return true;
06472     else {
06473         Error(pos, "Multiple overloaded instances of function \"%s\" matched.",
06474               funName);
06475 
06476         // select the matches that have the lowest cost
06477         std::vector<Symbol *> bestMatches;
06478         int minCost = matches[0].first;
06479         for (unsigned int i = 1; i < matches.size(); ++i)
06480             minCost = std::min(minCost, matches[i].first);
06481         for (unsigned int i = 0; i < matches.size(); ++i)
06482             if (matches[i].first == minCost)
06483                 bestMatches.push_back(matches[i].second);
06484 
06485         // And print a useful error message
06486         lPrintOverloadCandidates(argPos, bestMatches, callTypes, argCouldBeNULL);
06487 
06488         // Stop trying to find more matches after an ambigious set of
06489         // matches.
06490         return true;
06491     }
06492 }
06493 
06494 
06495 bool
06496 FunctionSymbolExpr::ResolveOverloads(SourcePos argPos,
06497                                      const std::vector<const Type *> &argTypes,
06498                                      const std::vector<bool> *argCouldBeNULL) {
06499     triedToResolve = true;
06500 
06501     // Functions with names that start with "__" should only be various
06502     // builtins.  For those, we'll demand an exact match, since we'll
06503     // expect whichever function in stdlib.ispc is calling out to one of
06504     // those to be matching the argument types exactly; this is to be a bit
06505     // extra safe to be sure that the expected builtin is in fact being
06506     // called.
06507     bool exactMatchOnly = (name.substr(0,2) == "__");
06508 
06509     // Is there an exact match that doesn't require any argument type
06510     // conversion (other than converting type -> reference type)?
06511     if (tryResolve(lExactMatch, argPos, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL))
06512         return true;
06513 
06514     if (exactMatchOnly == false) {
06515         // Try to find a single match ignoring references
06516         if (tryResolve(lMatchIgnoringReferences, argPos, argTypes, 
06517                        argCouldBeNULL))
06518             return true;
06519 
06520         // Try to find an exact match via type widening--i.e. int8 ->
06521         // int16, etc.--things that don't lose data.
06522         if (tryResolve(lMatchWithTypeWidening, argPos, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL))
06523             return true;
06524 
06525         // Next try to see if there's a match via just uniform -> varying
06526         // promotions.
06527         if (tryResolve(lMatchIgnoringUniform, argPos, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL))
06528             return true;
06529 
06530         // Try to find a match via type conversion, but don't change
06531         // unif->varying
06532         if (tryResolve(lMatchWithTypeConvSameVariability, argPos, argTypes,
06533                        argCouldBeNULL))
06534             return true;
06535     
06536         // Last chance: try to find a match via arbitrary type conversion.
06537         if (tryResolve(lMatchWithTypeConv, argPos, argTypes, argCouldBeNULL))
06538             return true;
06539     }
06540 
06541     // failure :-(
06542     const char *funName = candidateFunctions.front()->name.c_str();
06543     Error(pos, "Unable to find matching overload for call to function \"%s\"%s.",
06544           funName, exactMatchOnly ? " only considering exact matches" : "");
06545     lPrintOverloadCandidates(argPos, candidateFunctions, argTypes, 
06546                              argCouldBeNULL);
06547     return false;
06548 }
